Reviews.Title: “A visit to Vancouver to see "Cats"”
Reviews.Author: nosniborard
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been upgraded and we had no complaints regarding the accommodation or the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family!”
Reviews.Author: Fussybutfair69
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is older......but DO NOT let that get in your way. Superb location for families, clean, with friendly staff. Very close to Stanley Park and English Bay. More variety of restaurants than you can shake a stick at within a two block radius, but also a 30% discount in house on evening dining. Great having a fridge in the room, and a market for odds and ends in the mini-mall attached. The kids loved the pool, and having a walk out balcony to take in the view was a treat. We would use this hotel again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as part of a groupon promotion. The accommodations are dated, but clean and the location is great. The area is fun to walk around and just off the beaten track of Robson. There is a movie theater on the bottom of the hotel for easy access to a quick flick if desired. We'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but it has nice views.”
Reviews.Author: Marchouston1987
Reviews.Content: The coast is on the older part of downtown. The rooms looked like they were from the 80's. Everything worked fine in the room, except for the low water pressure. The ceilings in the shower are a bit short too. If you're over 6' it could get annoying. This was my first time in Vancouver, so I didn't know what part of town was the best for a young guy. I learnedthat gastown is the newest most active area. The hotel is only a short walk from Stanley park, and some amazing views. Even though the rooms were dated, they were nice. Overall it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Bob1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11 nights at the Coast Plaza. The hotel decor is a little tired and there were signs of wear and tear in the shower. However, the suite was spotlessly clean and quite well-appointed. The view was excellent. The hotel is well-placed in the West End and is within walking distance of almost everything in downtown Vancouver, and is also next to Stanley Park. Staff were friendly and helpful (they responded to a 'broken TV' call withing 5 minutes {though they fixed this by moving the bedroom TV into the living area and took no further action}). We've stayed here before and will do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cengizg29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to many of the attractions you would want.... Stanley Park, restaurants, Robson street is a few blocks away, theatres in the hotel area

Reviews.Title: “Family get away”
Reviews.Author: Charles D
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for English Bay and Stanley Park. Lots of restaurants close by, good atmosphere in the area. Hotel rooms a little tired looking but clean and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderluster60
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are in serious need of complete renovation but the location of the hotels is probably the best in all of Vancouver! Easy walk to fabulous beach, the sea wall, Stanley Park and tons of restaurants. We put up with the crappy rooms for the great views overlooking English Bay (ask for Bay view!) and the great location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, service and location”
Reviews.Author: SnorkleNut
Reviews.Content: We had TravelZoo coupons for a two-night stay. From our call to book the room to our checkout, the service we received was excellent. The concierage desk was very helpful in giving maps and marking the best routes to areas we wanted to explore. Being able to park our car in the covered parking garage was nice. We were on the 17th floor which had been updated and had a nice view of the rooftop garden. The hotel is located near many restaurants and in a safe area close to Stanley Park. We would definitely use the hotel again when visiting Vancouver, BC.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Tim P
Reviews.Content: Large room, upgraded due to low season. excellent views, good staff. recently updated.

Reviews.Title: “Great View!!”
Reviews.Author: Banana9999
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here while visiting. Great service, friendly staff clean rooms, excellent location. Will recommend again for future visitors :))

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Views and Location!”
Reviews.Author: cynlouhoo
Reviews.Content: I waffled between giving this hotel a 3 or a 4 rating. The views and location make it a solid 4 for sure! Pros: -Location! So close to the beach and Stanley Park and countless amazing restaurants. -Super comfortable beds! -Spacious suite (we had a 2 bedroom on 32nd floor). It even had 1.5 bathrooms! -Amazing views from 2 balconies! Ocean, Stanley Park, and Lion's Gate Bridge views.....beautiful day or night. -Full kitchen in our suite -Free Wireless Cons: -Outdated decor throughout mixed with a few newer pieces. Bathrooms and kitchen were super dated! -Kitchen not properly equipped. Bare minimum of dishes, etc. Tiny coffee pot. Old, loud dishwasher and an old microwave (took more than 3 minutes for popcorn and burnt bag before popping all the kernals!) -No pool towels. Had to bring towels from the room. Room had just 4 bathtowels in it. -Parking $25/day (though this is not uncommon in the area). -Tiny TV in the massive livingroom. -Small dining table with only 2 chairs. Seemed a bit strange for a large 2 bdrm suite with a full kitchen. -Basic and minimal single use toiletry items. Large refillable bottles of lotion and bath gel in both bathrooms might be good from a enviromnental point of view, but from a safety and cleanliness point of view, not good at all. Overall, the views and location probably outweigh the list of cons, but if you are fairly picky and like updated rooms, you may be a little disappointed. And, if you don't get a room with amazing views, you may be a lot disappointed! Most definately this would be an awesome location for viewing the fireworks (if you book a view room). Bring binoculars!

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms, But Hotel is Not Fully Renovated”
Reviews.Author: kayehm
Reviews.Content: Booked via Hotwire for the Family Day weekend in February. The hotel was in a state of being renovated. Piles of carpet in the lobby and carpet in hallways was to be replaced over that weekend. The room was very large and clean - but definitely not renovated. Still old furniture from the 80's with old bathroom fixtures and very worn carpet in the room. Beds at least appeared to be new. Great location near the beach and Stanley park meant I didn't have to spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous view, walking distance to the beach”
Reviews.Author: justmy0pinion
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, walking distance to lots of attraction. Stayed on the 25th floor with an amazing view. Friendly staff, clean rooms. Quiet even though it's in a busy area.

Reviews.Title: “major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Debbie4593
Reviews.Content: We purchased a great deal through Travelocity for a superior suite and were VERY disappointed. The room was extremely outdated, the room was large but sparse - hardly any furniture at all and the kitchen & bathroom were horrific. The pool/hottub area was not any better. I couldn't believe how outdated this entire hotel was, especially since Vancouver had just hosted the Olympics, I was expecting something so much better. Clearly, the pictures posted of the rooms were NOT what we got. This was by far one of the lousiest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. The view was awful - our room was facing a horrible part of the city - run down buildings and homeless people everywhere. Plus, we were located right next to the elevator and the bedroom was against the wall of the elevator shaft, so we heard the elevator all night long. TOTALLY NOT WORTH THE MONEY - GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's Best-Kept Secret!”
Reviews.Author: CoyneToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel has huge, clean rooms with balconies overlooking English Bay, the mountains and Stanley Park (or city views, if preferred). It has an enormous indoor pool (by hotel standards) with opens at 6:00 every morning. It's only minutes away from downtown on foot and the street below is rife with restaurants offering everything from fine dining to fast-food and everything in between. There's even a mall below the hotel at street level with a large supermarket, interesting shops and believe it or not, a full-size movie theatre. The staff are polite, friendly, helpful and very efficient. In short, this is a very well-run hotel in a choice part of the city. There's virtually not another one like it anywhere in Vancouver and there's nowhere else that we would choose to stay--regardless of price!

Reviews.Title: “Great conference”
Reviews.Author: MacCameron
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for ICT conference. Food was fantastic. Most impressed with food servers and staff.

Reviews.Title: “They made me feel like we weere staying there for too little $$$”
Reviews.Author: cyntia n
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal online for this hotel and we stayed 2 nights. Although it has a great location and the rooms are quite large and clean, the front desk staff pointed out a couple of times that we paid too little money for the room and immediately dismissed any requests we had (extra towels!!!)...too bad!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Olga2410
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Coast Plaza Hotel and Suites with friends for just one night. It was a quick weekend gateway from Seattle, US. Location is great! But views from the room were just fabulous! Room was ok - very simple. We were away almoust whole day and came at late night, so couldn't explore hotel facilities in fully. Check - out morning was very sunny and warm, so we could fully enjoy fantastic views from the 24th floor.

Reviews.Title: “++++++ Excellent Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: William B
Reviews.Content: Six star service for more then affordable rates. I highly reccoment!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Christie F
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on our room, and when we arrived they gave us a few free upgrades for my husband's birthday. The room was a very good size, with a spectacular view! The pool and hot tub were great. The location is perfect to check out Stanley Park, lots of excellent restaurants, And English Bay. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Really good place”
Reviews.Author: UKDavidN
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here last month despite not being in one of the renovated rooms. Views are great due to lack of nearby hotels; staff very friendly; pretty good location though its a bus ride downtown; free leisure facilities next door are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel made better by some wonderful upgrades”
Reviews.Author: KJMCC
Reviews.Content: Was very happy to see Coast has upgraded this property. Had a fantastic stay. Flat screen tv's, new beds, new kitchen in the suite. Incredible view of English Bay. Same great staff as before...and now the product matches the team.

Reviews.Title: “An Old Favorite”
Reviews.Author: onedery
Reviews.Content: I go to Vancouver fairly often and try to stay at the Coast whenever I do. This has been the case for more than 20 years now! So, yes it is not a new Hotel. But the location can not be beat, and the staff are always helpful and fantastic. The rooms are ok - they try hard. it is not luxurious, but more than comfortable. I shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Location is the highlight”
Reviews.Author: vekel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a primo location for walking the sea wall, going to Stanley Park, and for shopping in some wonderful stores. The restaurant choices are fantastic as well. We did purchase a promo room and quite honestly they should have given us a promo room. The room we got was OK but it didn't encourage me to visit again. I know they had better rooms available because it certainly wasn't busy. I have stayed at this hotel before and had the newly renovated room and it was nice. The older rooms appear dirty and I would not have a bath in the tub. I usually check the bedding in any hotel and found this hotel to be acceptable. I think they should promote the nice rooms and if they run out of those, then offer the other rooms. This would have worked nice for us and I would have felt taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good Stay at the Coast Plaza Hotel & Suites”
Reviews.Author: Puttersea
Reviews.Content: This is probably about the 10th time I have stay at the establishment so I thought I would finally write a little review on my current stay in this Hotel. First off I want to mention that this was a Priceline reservation and prior to the reservation I went in and requested a Upper Floor room. Of course the people in reservation were quick to advise me that with this type of reservation nothing is guarranteed. Of course with me being a frequent priceline/hotwire user this did not phase me. We arrived at the hotel around 4:00 p.m. Pulled into the parking garage, no parking attendant on duty with a sign that says "will return in 15 minutes". Well what to do? Well we went ahead and went on in and checked in. Everything was fine with the parking, just remember to bring your license plate number to the front desk. Checkin process was smooth, except he proceeded to tell us that the highest floor we can obtain with a priceline reservation was the 10th floor. Wasn't to thrilled about that considering there are about 34 floors of rooms in this hotel. But, the 10th floor was acceptable. Of course, he was willing to upgrade us for $20. a night to a higher floor. No special occassion for this trip so "no thanks". But at the very end of the process he said he will put us on the 17th floor. "Score!" It pays to be nice. Parking: $25.00 per night. Ouch!!! (Never understood why hotels charge for parking for their guests, but we all know the word "GREED" don't we). HINT: If you self park your car on the otherside of the hotel off of Nelson Street and use the automated machines it is only $20.00 a night and it is still the hotel parking garage. I mentioned this to the front desk and they had no idea about it. Go Figure. Pets: $25.00 per night which is about standard to Vancouver hotels. However, this hotel is the best for pets as it is only a few blocks from the park. HINT: There is a offleash dog park South on Comox street about 8 blocks. Elevators: We had no problem with the elevators except when we checked out. Took us forever to get an elevator down as everyone was leaving at the same time. Otherwise, I felt they were acceptable. Room: I thought our room was very clean and the view nice. They now have LCD TV's in the rooms which I don't remember them ever having before. We had a full kitchen which was nice. One of the floor lamps was very wabble and all I had to do was re-tighten it up. Not sure why housekeeping had never done that. Bathroom was pink and clean. How cool is that!!! Overlall even though furniture and fixtures were a little outdated, I was happy with my room. It was very quiet at night. It was even missing a can opener and the promptly brought one to our room. Pool/Gym: They have free access to the gym next door, they won't tell you this when you have a priceline reservation, but I have stayed there before and the gym is nice. The pool and jacuizzi area was nice and the jacuizzi was hot and the locker room with sauna was clean. Check out: Automated check out from the television which I always like. Well that pretty much sums it up. Overall I was happy with this trip. I don't think I would care to pay full price for this hotel especially in the summer months, but for a priceline/hotwire reservation it is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: HollsZ
Reviews.Content: My room was not clean. There were TOENAIL clippings on the carpet by the bed. Sink and tub were not cleaned thouroughly. I complained at the front desk and they didn't try hard enough to make things right for me. I ended up with no compensation for my awful experience but the promise to "take good care of me next time". There will never ever be a next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and great location - Building needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: wmdolman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night as part of a weekend vacation package that we won through a radio station giveaway. We checked in about 2 hours early, and were given a room right away, which was in a fairly quiet corner on the 17th floor. For a standard/basic room, it had a great view of the mountains, highrises and a sliver of English Bay. My first impression of the staff was great. The bell staff are extremely amiable and friendly. They helped us with finding a taxi and directing us to a few tour stops we did on the trip. The front desk clerks were very kind and helpful during the entire trip. I was a bit apprehensive at first to stay at this hotel, after reading that this is a converted residential apartment block built in the late 1960's or early 1970's and converted into a mixed-use commercial hotel. The beds were brand new and very comfortable. The duvets and bedding were also brand new. However, the 1980's Dynasty crystal lamps and chintzy curtains didn't compliment the great bedding. The bathroom is another story. You kind of walk three decades into the past as you walk toward the bathroom. The bedding and television (flatscreen) seem to be from this actual decade, the furniture and curtains are from the 1980's, and the fridge seems to be from the 1970's. The bathroom is very outdated. Hopefully, they are doing remodeling and upgrades in phases, starting with the bedding and television sets. The tub is one of those old ceramic larger tubs from the 1960's, and the toilet is purple. The wallpaper seems to have been changed in the 1980's. A classic Honeywell thermostat sits on the wall, and mirrors our outdated one from our 1950's home. Even with the ecclectic hodgepodge of furnishings and styles, the room was fairly quiet and comfortable (even with a large convention taking place in the hotel during our stay). The swimming pool was in the basement, and it was very large and clean. One problem is the very cramped and slow elevators. We waited for an elevator for 7 minutes before giving up and sojurning up the stairs. And when you do get an elevator, it barely will accommodate 5 people comfortably. Try that with lots of luggage. All in all, the hotel does need some more work, but I think they are heading in the right direction. This location can boast a convenient trek to Stanley Park and Robson Street, as well as a short journey to a built in mall downstairs in case you forgot to pack that must-needed amenity, such as a portable umbrella, to weather a rainy November Vancouver day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing for a Coast”
Reviews.Author: Fate_tw
Reviews.Content: Where to begin...this is an old building, and it shows. It's desperately in need of updates. There are 4 elevators for the hotel, all are extremely slow. The room I was in looked straight out of the 70's, from the purple fixtures in the bathroom to the polyester tailored bed spread that gets washed once a month. The lino in the kitchenette had holes in it, the wall paper was coming apart at the seams. There was mold on the roof in the bathroom, likely due to no ventilation available. Thank goodness the wi-fi is free, because when you can maintain a connection (router was constantly booting me) it's extremely slow. There was a mild wind one night which kept slamming a vent somewhere on the building right outside my window, was extremely frustrating. Will not be staying at this Coast again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Heather W
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute. This hotel is close to many amenities, very friendly staff, great food & very quiet. One night we walked to sea bus and took a great ride over to Granville Island to eat dinner, the other nights we wandered around until we found any ethnic food we wanted, we also had dessert at a fabulous little bakery. ALL WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE !! The hotel is very clean, very quiet and the pool and hot tub were fabulous. I will be back with my family next time !!

Reviews.Title: “Suite spot in Vancouver......”
Reviews.Author: serene-goddess
Reviews.Content: Good value. In a fab.location. The west-end is a vibrant neighbourhood close to all the highlights of Vancouver. Short walk to Robson shopping and the city but close to the beach and cafes . I love having a small kitchen when I am in the city.....chill the wine , keep left-overs from great local eateries ,store fruit and yoghurt for an early breakfast. The decor is dated and the wallpaper was starting to peel in a few corners .....definately need new linens and duvets ....that would help. But for the price and location ....it is a good home away from home. The pub was packed on thurs.eve ....30% off & a hockey game! Average pub fare. Always come home to the friendly staff at Coast plaza. We did miss feeding the squirrels at the front door!

Reviews.Title: “Tattered at the edges”
Reviews.Author: NorthVancouverBobo
Reviews.Content: An old apartment complex turned into a hotel. Great location and adequate accomodations. I was put off by the continental breakfast which consisted of obvious previously frozen miniature sized pastries. I was expecting more for the price. The staff were very professional and friendly and did their best to make me feel welcome. I would recommend it for its location above all, just don't expect anything fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good food and a welcoming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BigJohnShropshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three very comfortable nights in this hotel. It compared extremely well with the other 4 star hotels we had stayed in in Montreal, Ottawa, Toronto, Banff and Jasper. Very handy location for the incomparable Stanley Park and for Denman and Davie Streets, Sunset Beach, West End and English Bay, but somewhat out of the way from the city centre,Waterfont and Gastown. Nevertheless, city transport is great and nowhere seems too distant on foot. A great variety of eateries within a stonesthrow of the hotel. The large lobby was manned by friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff, the banks of lifts kept waiting time to a minimum and the rooms on the 18th floor were spacious, clean, comfortable and well appointed - apart from a lack of overhead lighting, which made reading difficult. The swimming pool was larger than many - some 18 x 14 metres & reasonably warm, the whirlpool and saunas were good. TVs in the bedrooms were large & modern, writing desks & armchairs were functional, hanging space was generous. We enjoyed tasty meals in the restaurant and the brasserie. Good steaks and fish & chips. Friendly & efficient service and reasonable prices for wines & beers. My only complaints were that the top floor proved inaccessible and, as with all the other Canadian hotels we stayed in, the pillows were too large & the loo paper too thin!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tstsa
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for one week and it was great. We selected a King suite with a kitchen as we wanted to have breakfast there. The room was a great size with a wonderful view. It was a little tired and could use with some updating especially in the kitchen and bathroom. The room was very quiet and had a big balcony. The location made it perfect. Close to stores and restaurants as well as Stanley Park. The bed was very comfortable as well. The staff were all very polite and efficient. Would stay here again if in Vancouver even though it is not a fancy hotel but had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Stanley Park and English Bay -- Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Johann806
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Coast Plaza many times over the years. We always enjoy our stay and this trip was no exception. This hotel meets all of our requirements: clean, great location, value, and it has great staff too. English Bay and the seawall are practically just outside the door and Stanley Park is Just minutes away, as are Coal Harbour and False Creek (Granville Island). Easy public transportation on Denman makes it easy to get anywhere in the city. There are MANY restaraunts on Denman covering a broad range of cuisines. If one is looking for a relaxing stay with easy access to fabulous walking and views and food, I can't think of a better location. Our 22nd floor room had a view of English Bay. A grocery store in the complex at street level is convenient to get fruit and other staples.The kitchenette with a fride is very useful on a longer stay. My only negative comment is that, in our room, Wi-Fi was very slow. We are looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Location With Pleasant Surrounding Walks”
Reviews.Author: DiggoryLondon
Reviews.Content: During our three week visit to Canada my wife & myself stayed in this hotel twice. On the first occasion we were allocated Room 1802 which had a balcony with a view of the harbour. The second visit found us in Room 3205 this gave us not only harbour but mountain views. When booking in - should you have a head for heights - take up the offer of a room at the top of the hotel - you will not be disappointed with the views. This is a really good hotel, all the staff are very friendly & helpful. It was very clean and both of our rooms ( and bathrooms) were furnished to a good standard. Whenever we passed a member of the cleaning staff in the corridor we were always greeted with a smile & a 'good day' followed by an enquiry as to whether everything was correct with our room. Being English ( & not a coffee drinker) it was pleasant to find extra tea bags had been placed in our room, this was an extremely nice thought. We had the continental breakfast which was more than sufficient. The restaurant waiter proved to be a valuable source of information regarding places to visit & more importantly in which order. The harbour, beach & Stanley Park are all within walking distance. Although this hotel is slightly out of town in a more suburban setting it resulted in a more tranquil stay. However, within 20 minutes of walking you can be in the centre of the city. Following our two visits, I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “always a treat”
Reviews.Author: amoamore
Reviews.Content: when in vancouver i always stay @ the coast plaza. while conveniently located ( a 15 minute walk to granville and well serviced by public transportation) i appreciate the location in the west end as it is just removed from the hurly burly of downtown and adjacent to both english bay and stanley park. very relaxing i am usually upgraded to a high floor ( it pays to ask) and the views on all four sides of the hotel are spectacular. most if not all of the rooms have balconies so fresh air is immediately adjacent to the room. the rooms are large and comfortable. staff are uniformly kind, efficient and charming. the hotel sits above the denman shopping mall so there are plenty of services right below you including a low cost super market. there is an overabundance of good restaurants at all price points within a 1-10 minute walk. room service comes up from the coffee shop in the lobby and is extremely reasonable. on my last stay i had scrambled eggs, canadian back bacon, hash browns and toast and jam for $10. !!

Reviews.Title: “A Feel Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clubmed63
Reviews.Content: I have learned from reading Tripadvisor for several years now, that everyones' expectations are different. For me, the important features of accommodations are that I am greeted with a warm and efficient attitude. Staff should be trained to always remember who pays their wages. As far as the accommodations are concerned, I have stayed in many hotels in various countries, from Europe to Asia and here at home and my main expectations are that the room is CLEAN. Otherwise I am not demanding since I mainly stay in budget hotels. Now, to my review of the Coast Plaza Hotel; I attended a conference for two days, Sept 30 / Oct.01 with my wife. The booking was pre arranged. We arrived at approximately 4p.m. and were greeted by Shannon at the desk. I asked her if it was possible to get a view room and although the hotel was apparently booked quite full, she could give us a choice of a room with a king bed on the 7th floor or a room with two double beds on the 19th floor which we chose. You see, it's all about service. Thank you Shannon. Both my wife and I were happy with the accommodations. The room was a good size, approximately 18 ft. square not including the hallway or bathroom. The fact that it had a rather long hallway made the room seem larger since you did not walk into the room directly. There were three closets; one in the bathroom, one in the hallway and one in the room proper. (never seen that before!) As mentioned in many reviews, the furniture was dated, but I don't stay in the room for the furniture. It was perfectly o.k. and in good condition. As I mentioned above, I look for cleanliness and this room was that. The bathroom was interesting in that it had a fore room with a sink vanity and another sink vanity in the bathroom proper which makes it convenient for two persons using two sinks at the same time. The bathroom was clean and had all the required amenities including plenty of towels. The room had a refrigerator and a coffee maker, a flat screen t.v. which was a little far from the bed due to the size of the room but no big issue. There is a portable air con, and, although we did not use it because of the time of year, I did turn it on momentarily to test for noise. It was acceptable in my opinion. Both my wife and I agree the bed was great; like sleeping on a cloud (if that were possible) and of course, clean linen. There is a beautiful view from the balcony partially facing English Bay and The North Shore. The hotel is situated in a very convenient and pleasant location of the west end with many shops and restaurants on Denman and Davie Streets. We walked along English Bay to the little ferry boat which we took to Granville Island. There, we roamed around the overpriced shops and listened to some wonderful pan floutist from Peru in the square. Wonderful and memorable. A buffet breakfast was provided in the conference room on the upper floor (The Horizon Room) which was tasty, consisting of scrambled eggs, hash brown potatoes, sausage, bacon, fresh fruit, fruit juices, coffee, tea and buns. For our coffee breaks we were provided with Nanaimo bars, brownies, cookies and more fresh fruit with coffee and tea, altogether, very good. Did I have any negatives? Yes, I will mention a few issues that I saw. A couple of resin chairs on the balcony would have been nice. I did not want to take the inside wooden chairs onto the balcony due to possible damage from weather. A microwave would have been nice, and also an iron and ironing board. Perhaps you can get an iron if you ask at the desk. I did not try, so I don't know. Another thing, I did not see any robes in the closets, since the hotel has a pool, it would make sense to provide robes so that one can go to the pool via the elevator in a robe. Again, perhaps robes are available upon request, I did not ask. These are not complaints, only observations and suggestions. The only complaint I have is the cost of parking. $25.00 per day to park a car, in my opinion, is outrageous!!! Although my parking was paid for by the conference I would find it very difficult to stay in this hotel for this reason alone. You are pretty much held hostage to pay that if you book at this hotel and drive there from out of town. I think that guests should get a break with a lower parking rate since the rooms are already priced at a premium rate. Thank you for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: westcoastcutie
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel in a great location. Room was big with a sitting area, table, and full kitchen. Conference facilities and catering were fine. Rooms were a bit expensive but overall I would be comfortable staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay but Dated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PsychRN12
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference that was occurring in the same hotel. My stay was okay but this hotel is definitely showing its age. The lobby and service were excellent. My room was on the 22nd floor and had a fair view of English Bay. However, the furniture in my room looked quite old. There were scratches and dents on the tables and chairs. There was no desk for working. I had a full kitchen but very dated appliances. There was no central air conditioning, rather there was a small portable unit that did not have a thermostat on it. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were flat and the linens were old (I had a bedspread that looked like it was from the 90's). The TV would go fuzzy from time to time depending on where it was positioned between the bed and the living room. One of the more interesting features were the pink porcelain toilet and bathtub (again, looked like out of the early 90's). Food was great - especially the 30% off for all orders from hotel guests. As well, internet was free though could be very slow depending how many people were on at a time. Access to a full fitness club was a nice touch. The pool was okay, but located in the basement and had no natural light. The conference rooms were hot and stuffy most of the time. Also, this hotel attempted to charge me $70 when my travel plans changed and I needed to check out a day earlier. I was not aware of this and was also told by the staff the night before that this would not be an issue. Ultimately, the fee was waved. My stay was okay, but I expected more from the Coast name. Though I did only pay $149/night with conference rate, this hotel costs much more, therefore I would expect more from it. The location was great being very close to downtown, English Bay, and Stanley Park. However, the price for what you get is a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been perfect if it wasn't for bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: jessicat783
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the perfect location! It was within walking distance to the coast (hence the name Coat Plaza) and many yummy restaurants. The hotel was dated, but comfortable and spacious. We were really happy with our one night weekend getaway until I got home and noticed that I was covered in bite marks. Considering we were pretty bundled up while we were outside and the location of the bites (all on the lower half of my body - feet, legs, stomach) I have to believe the only place I could have been bitten was sleeping under the covers at the hotel. It really was a great, affordable place, but I am so disappointed that maybe things weren't cleaned as well as they should have been.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: g2fly
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel through expedia and were happy with the rate we got (we found out later that if you find a better deal than the hotel offers, they will beat the price). We arrived on a busy night even though it was mid-week (Kings of Leon concert night), but even so the service was fast and very friendly. We were upgraded free of charge to a suite and given a voucher for $25.00 off at the restaurant (so we had a lovely breakfast for next to nothing the next morning). The hotel was attractive and clean, I don't personally care much about the age of the decor (hate the reno industry) as long as the hotel is well-maintained and in very good repair and the Coast Plaza is. Our suite had a sitting area with an attractive view, a kitchen and dining area and a separate bedroom. The bed was moderately comfortable but the street noise made sleeping a little difficult. Ear plugs might be a good idea. We didn't have the time to use the spa facilities. They were pricey but supposedly excellent. The location of the hotel is perfect for anyone who wants to enjoy the west end of Vancouver - walking distance to the clubs and restaurants. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Chilled66
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights at the Coast Plaza, first impressions were it was a little dated but we were (without request) upgraded to a suite with complementary breakfast which saved us a fortune over the 7 nights stay. Looking at some comments and photos I think we definately got one of the better rooms as it was spacious with a kitchen and seperate lounge area. We were on the 25th floor so had great views of Vancouver and were really pleased with the location, just a short walk away from the beautiful Stanley Park and busy Denman Street. Ok so you could hear the generator and we were right next to the elevator but as we only used the room for a base we weren't too bothered by it. Staff were more than helpful and polite. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel in a Beautiful Setting”
Reviews.Author: RAL46
Reviews.Content: The Coast Plaza is frequently referred to as the Coast at Stanley Park. This high rise hotel has a distant and obstructed view of Vancouver's world famous park, but it is actually closer to English Bay and the cafe culture of Denman and Davie Streets. The hotel was built in 1969 as the Denman Street Inn, and includes a small shopping centre and cinema at the street level. In the past 42 years, it has changed hands and brands twice, and has been part of the reputable Coast chain for over twenty years. Large signs in the lobby proclaim its history and outline some multi-million dollar upgrades that are forthcoming (and, in many areas, badly needed). My wife and I arrived at the Coast at the four o'clock check-in time, but were informed that the room was not yet ready (fortunately, we were permitted to park in the underground parkade). We walked around the area, enjoyed the sunshine, ocean views, and crowds at English Bay, and returned at least twice to be informed that the room wasn't quite ready yet. When it finally was, we were given two drink vouchers to reward us for our patience. The room was on the twenty-sixth floor, overlooking the park, bay, and many high rise apartments and condos. Our first impression was not good: two double beds rather than the queen-size we were expecting. However, when we checked our (on-line) reservation details, it did in fact say "Superior Room 2 doubles or 1 Queen". Seeing as how we had waited so long to finally get our room, we chose to put up with it. The room itself was just okay--older carpet, spreads, etc., but clean and in good repair. A free-standing air conditioner was wedged inbetween the curtains and what turned out to be my bed. Considering the hotel was rather old, we assumed this was an afterthought, and at night, it was a toss up between the noise of the conditioner and the traffic noise (even on the 26th floor!) if we opened the patio doors. A large but empty-of-seats balcony was an unusual feature (although not a surprise as we had stayed at this hotel some years ago). The bathroom was a mixture of figure colors (dusty rose toilet) and styles, but functional. We didn't eat in the large, bright restuarant, but it looked fine, and the prices were reasonable. The pub (Comox Street Long Bar) was bright and roomy: we enjoyed great nachos and our free drinks as we watched our beloved football team (Edmonton Eskimos) on one of the many TVs. The English Bay area is a great place to enjoy the west end of downtown Vancouver: lots of interesting and diverse cafes, bars, shops, etc. The Coast, as the anchor hotel, is an okay place to stay, with friendly, accomodating staff, but hopefully, upgrades will actually happen. Hotel check-out was fine, although we thought the parking, at $25 a day (even for hotel guests), was steep.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: bellasnow
Reviews.Content: Really liked the located in the west end, so many stores and amenities are right around the corner. The one bedroom suite was very spacious. We asked for a room with a view but they said we'd have to pay extra for that? I guess I should have said a room on a higher floor since they put us on the first floor... with no view at all except facing the hotel generator? Not sure if it was a generator but it made noise. Room was nice and spacious, but I found it to be very dark (even though it was sunny outside) Kitchen lights didn't work at all. There were no regular lights in the bedroom either, except for the table lamp. I read many reviews prior that the rooms need updating so I knew what to expect! Overall a decent hotel to stay in if you get a good deal on a room. Disappointed we couldn't get any room higher up though.

Reviews.Title: “Do stay here”
Reviews.Author: LostInSpaceMan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for the bars and restaurants on Gilford St. It's clean and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravellerBC
Reviews.Content: What a great location and facility. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a beautiful suite with commanding view of English Bay beach whichnis only a block away. There has to be about 50 restaurants within a short stroll, a huge food store and drug store in the mall below the hotel itself. Stanley park is only a few blocks away! FREE wireless Internet too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, A bit dated”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Travel21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here August 2009, as the last stop of my west coast road trip with three friends. The hotel is in a great locations, the room was a good size with a kitchenette, and a balcony. The hotel is dated tho, and the bedroom with the two beds are literally next to each other maybe a foot of space between them. Not impressed with it but besides that its a great locations, close to bars, shops, and the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms far too dated”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_Anna_Jen
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings about this hotel. Location is good and staff were friendly. Parking was easy under hotel, although costs $25 plus tax per day. However, the problem was the rooms. We booked a 1 bed suite which was large but was like stepping back into the 70s (including the kitchen). Keen to spend as little time as possible in there. Also booked room with sea view but really looked into other flats (and the balcony is pretty horrible). Also room by lift which was pretty noisy, but not a major problem. The whole hotel needs a makeover, but particularly the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop before the cruise.”
Reviews.Author: stacy81598
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two families (2 rooms- 4 adults and three kids) in August before leaving on our cruise to Alaska. This is an older property, but it was clean, and the rooms are huge with a seperate bedroom and kitchen. The view from our side was amazing. The restaurant was excellent and the kids loved the indoor pool (the hot tub was out of order). The staff was excellent and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lisaj2020
Reviews.Content: We have only good things to say about our experience in Vancouver. Our one bedroom suite was very spacious for our family of four and well-priced since we stayed for 7 days. We were truly and happily surprised by the attentiveness of the front desk and concierge. Any request we had was handled promptly and in a friendly manner. Location on English Bay is absolutely fanrtastic! We loved the quick walk down to the beach and all the cute restaurants and quick lunch places on Denman street. Also, the supermarket and pharmacy located in the adjacent mall could be accessed via the hotel elevator which was very convenient. Overall, an excellent stay and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel, poor value for the money”
Reviews.Author: mayasl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located and the suites are spacious. However, the room we were given overlooked a construction site where work started every morning at 7 AM. Everything in the room was outdates, old and falling apart. The closet doors in the bedroom could not open much because they hit the bed. The fridge was falling apart (e.g. when the fruit drawer finally budged it fell out). I would have accepted all this if the (special Expedia) rate we were charged were not $280 a night! For that rate I expect something much better. The quality, in fact, was that of a low priced motel.

Reviews.Title: “felt like i was part of a neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: billwestroxbury
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room and facilities, exceptionally helpful staff and perfect relaxing location. Literally steps to great neighborhood restuarants (went to Cosca twice), a block or two to the water and to Stanley park, and a 7 minute bus ride to shopping and the central downtown (this is also only a 7-8 block interesting walk.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mchekaluk
Reviews.Content: Just off Denman near English Bay. Slightly dated but well maintained and no complaints from me. Big, fairly comfortable rooms. Room service is good and they don't rip you off like other hotels. I've stayed here a number of times and I love the location. The draw is Denman and Davies. Lots of food choices, and English Bay beach/park is right there. Perfect place for a romantic night or weekend away, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “They tried but failed”
Reviews.Author: Dana P
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel I asked for a lower floor they gave us a room when you looked over the balcony you saw the heating and cooling system for the hotel and by the way our room did not have central heat and air we had a small air conditioning unit in the front room of the suite that looked like a portable unit and we had to open up the sliding glass door to cool the room and the bedroom came equiped with a electric fan that you would have on a table top and plug in. with the door open it was so loud because of the hotel fans we could not hear the tv or each other the beds were marginal but the room was clean and we appreciated the kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, but solid”
Reviews.Author: familyprince
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in this hotel, the other being seven years ago. First, the location cannot be beat, on the West side near the water and not far from Stanley Park. The front desk people are very nice and efficient, not the greatest, but very good. The parking garage in under the hotel and is a little pricy, mine was picked up by work, but factor in about $20 per day. Easy access to the hotel from the parking garage. The first level of the hotel is retail and includes a grocery store and a drug store. The grocery store is not very good and over priced, but nice to have access to. The rest of the retail is not very useful. Room is dated, older rugs (pulling up some at the seams) and air conditioning units are portable and only cools the living area. The bedroom has a fan, which worked fine but is strange for a hotel. All room have a small kitchen, which is nice to make some breakfast and a night time snack. Bathroom is nicely sized and clean, nothing special, just solid. Be careful to not get a room anywhere near the elevators if you get a middle floors room. They are very active and noisy at night and some of our work party had issues. I was on the 27th floor and although I noticed the sound, they rarely came up that high so I was not bothered. On the lobby level is two restaurants, one is a pub with a very limited eating menu and the other is a full service eatery that is, IMHO, overpriced for the food and service. Better off going into the neighborhood which has an endless supply of food and drink. Even a liquor store less than a block away. Overall, a solid hotel in a nice area of town. If you get a good price, this place is worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcoming & Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Gema28
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, to the day I checked out of this hotel, all the employee's were so warm welcoming and helpful. This really is "service with a smile". Very friendly, clean, well managed and great location. Shannon at the front desk checked me in efficiently and was so pleasant & professional to interact with. Janet in the restaurant was equally cheerful and efficient. The housekeeping staff were really attentive and polite...and kindly came each evening with cold water and chocolates...such a nice personal touch. The location of this hotel is the icing on the cake. Wonderful ocean views from the rooms (stunning sunsets!!) and a couple of minutes walk to the sandy beach, shops and restaurants. It is a great "home away from home"!! Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: Kathini
Reviews.Content: The staff were fantastic at making my kids feel welcome at the hotel. They were given stuffies and colouring books when we checked in, and the man at the front desk recommended where to eat that would be appropriate for kids. The crib they brought in for my 22 month old was good, but the foam mattress was very thin and split open along the side. I ended up just wrapping it in a blanket. Parking was expensive at $25 for 24 hrs, but it was really safe and secure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great View of the Fireworks”
Reviews.Author: joggerbill
Reviews.Content: My buddies and I stayed here after a 2-day bike ride from Seattle that ended in the hotel parking garage. The staff was helpful in correcting an error made with our reservation. Our room was clean and spacious with a great view of the fireworks celebration in the harbor. The beds were comfortable. There were ample toiletries and plenty of towels. There are many restaurants in the area and two Starbucks within waking distance. The housekeeping staff provided extra chairs to us for viewing the fireworks. I think the rooms were a bit overpriced but it was worth it for the convenience of being able to take the elevator to our room rather than transporting our luggage blocks to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down and Out of the Way!”
Reviews.Author: Maple1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights while attending a conference at the hotel. My first impression of the exterior was old and was dingy. It was also off the beaten path (about a 15 minute walk to the centre (Robson and Burrard) and the same to Granville island - although the walk along the water and beaches was very nice. The room decor was very dated and old looking. The beds had bedspreads and old sheets and blankets. In fact the light yellow/beige sheets had holes in them. Any hotel that charges over $200.00/night should have nice white sheets and duvets! Please...no dirty bedspreads! The staff offered to give me extra sheets to stay warm because I told them I would not use the bedspreads. To my surprise, the gentleman at the desk said "I would not use them either". I've stayed at the Sheraton and Hyatt for less and they were awesome. I would not stay here again - unless you want to be in the west end and don't mind an old dingy hotel with bedspreads and worn sheets!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: rachelkurt
Reviews.Content: Our suite was spacious, had a full kitchen and a wonderful view on English Bay and the Ocean! Linda and Vince were instrumental in ensuring we enjoyed our stay and were assigned a suite that matched our needs. Thanks to the whole team! Rachel

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, helpful staff but needs a refurb and location could be an issue”
Reviews.Author: ayresee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in 2 blocks during our holiday and on both occassions got upgraded as there were 3 of us, we also got free breakfast which I'm not sure is standard or from the upgrade but this made a difference financially. They also give everyone 30% off the food bill in their restaurant which has good standar fare if you dont fancy venturing very far. All the staff we dealt with were very pleasant and were happy to go that extra mile. The pool is in the basement but is a decent size. The only downsides are the whole hotel seems a bit dated although there seems to be a refurb in the pipeline and its location may be an issue as whilst very good for Stanley Park and English Bay is a bit of a walk/short bus ride to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “There cannot be a better value in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: terryl0we
Reviews.Content: Although my room was not available until the afternoon, the wonderful staff "pre-registered" me, and the concierge relieved me of my bags. Once in the room I was very pleased with the essential comforts...but, the view was truly amazing! I was in room 3105 and had a full 180 view of the city! I too noticed that some updates within the hotel will be a welcome...but, for this seasoned traveler...there is no better value in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lyau394
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was very friendly. I had a suite on the 17th floor with a great view and jacuzzi tub. The location was close to many restaurants and Stanley Park. Only a 20 minute walk to the convention center. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, but needs an update”
Reviews.Author: bbon98
Reviews.Content: We booked this room because it's in a great location, close to many great restaurants and interesting shops. Our first room was quite large with a kitchenette. It felt as if we were thrown back into another decade. The bed was comfortable. However, the noise from the elevators was too loud. The front desk was accomodating at request to be moved. The next room was even bigger, no kitchenette, but that was fine. The room was enormous, it had a cloak room, wet bar, and meeting table. This room was in need of an update as well. The sofas were very old and tired, the blankets were thread-bare and this bed was lumpy. I felt as if I had gone back to the 1980s. However it had an amazing view. Just beautiful, we spent most of our time on the balcony. Pros: Location, Cost, Friendly staff, huge rooms, and terrifice view Cons: Lumpy bed, very tired decor, thin blankets

Reviews.Title: “Good value now, renovation pending”
Reviews.Author: Edgy0416
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to be 1960s construction, with little renovation since (the concrete exterior is showing its age, the furniture is getting a little beat up, the toilet in my bathroom frequently took 2 flushes to clear completely, etc.). A major renovation is pending (allegedly underway, though I did not see any signs of it), and this should bring the hotel back up to the 3* level. Unfortunately, it will probably also raise the price to the lofty levels that are typical of Vancouver in the summer. In its current state, there is still a lot to like about the hotel. The staff was very helpful. The rooms were very clean. The area is very quiet (all I ever heard in my room was the nearby elevator). Also, the wireless is free ... but as slow as molasses (officially 1 MB/s.; that's a generous estimate) , in my experience. The hotel is located in a residential area near downtown ... S/F houses, high-rise apartments, many restaurants and shops along Denman St. (1 blk. away) and Davie St. (2 blks.). There is a neighborhood mall beneath the hotel, with a grocery store among other shops. Very much like Europe. There are refrigerators in the rooms, so you could buy food there and take it up to eat. It took me between 20 & 25 minutes to walk to the convention center at Canada Place (Google Maps says 25 min.). It is a pleasant walk with nice scenery. About the first half of the walk, down to Georgia St., is through a residential neighborhood, & the rest through the commercial center of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “LARGE SIZE ROOM, BUT BADLY NEEDS UPDATING!!!”
Reviews.Author: jainsea
Reviews.Content: My two grown daughters, a son-in-law, my granddaughter and myself stayed here for 3 nights - June 19,20 & 21, 2011 - we were in room 2501. The three good things I can say about the hotel is that it is in a great location(!), it had a great view, and the room was large - a large living room with a sofa bed, a kitchen, a bathroom and another bedroom with 2 double beds. However, everything was badly in need of updating and very diplapitated looking. The bathroom tub had stains in it and the whole bathroom looked like it was done in the 1950's. One of my daughters and I each slept in a double bed in the bedroom, and we now believe that the beds had bed bugs. I felt like something was crawling on me and was itchy every night, and she developed a rash of little red bumps. The sheets were very old, not crisp and white, the bedspread was very worn and it looked like those TV commercials where the kid jumps on the bed and all that dust comes out in the air. There was a closet in the bedroom but you couldn't open the door of it all the way, as one of the beds was in the way and couldn't be moved because of the size of the room. This hotel really needs a drastic facelift as soon as possible !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, tons of space”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltravels6
Reviews.Content: I booked this for one night on priceline, not knowing the hotel we'd get, just one downtown. My husband and I arrived very late from Tahiti and just spent the night here. We got a huge suite though, it was nice to have the space. They did not have kitchen things though, maybe you have to ask for them. We went out for a late snack as we were hungry. If you want anything in the area after 11pm, good luck most things are closed. But you can take a cab into the action. The front desk clerk was so nice and friendly at check in. She joked we had tans and must be coming back from somewhere. I hadn't noticed, but I guess compared to most people here who are pale, our slight tans were noticed! She said hi and good night to us as we came in and out of the lobby bringing our luggage up and the cart back down. I would stay here again, but now I live in Vancouver, it was only temporary before we found a place to live. The only thing I'd suggest is having something vegan available on the night room service menu. There was nothing for us so we had to leave to find something near by and it was scarce!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs a renovation”
Reviews.Author: Saskgal64
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the location and because it had a pool. I was surprised at the rundown look of the room and the bedding, drapes, etc. for the price we paid. Because we used travel reward points, we didn't have much of an out-of-pocket charge, but pricey it was. The room was clean and comfortable and had a nice sized tv, but don't expect duvets and beautiful carpet. We enjoyed the location which was only a couple of blocks to the ocean and Denman Street is lined with restaurants, cafes and specialty food stores. We walked to Robson where all of the shopping seemed to be. It has underground parking as well, which was handy.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Abbotsford by Far!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CadAlec
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed with many of the Hotels in Abbotsford and this is by far the best. The front desk staff are inviting, warm and quick to recall your name and any special requirements. I have an allergy that prevents me from staying in rooms cleaned with traditional cleaners and sprays. H/K always ensure my room is free of sprays and chemicals unlike other properties Ive stayed with where they simply say there were no chemicals used. The rooms are a good size and have a desk right in the room. I won't be staying anywhere else in Abbotsford again!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: lone_palm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in late May while working on a project that included meeting rooms in this hotel. A regular Vancouver visitor, I haven't stayed in this hotel in several years. The hotel has been going through some uprades, and I found the room to be large enough, clean and comfortable. The WiFi connection worked throughout the hotel wherever I was working, which was a plus. Very impressed with how pleasant, professional, and helpful the staff were - checking in and out, helping with luggage, and the banquet staff. The location was good and it has ample access to amenities. Only less positive comment would be the wait for, and speed of the elevators. Found that a bit disappointing, but overall a great stay and I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location! Concierge A+ with recommendations and helpfulness.”
Reviews.Author: momraven
Reviews.Content: Hotel room came w/ a microwave and refrigerator. Many grocery stores in the area. Coffee that came w/ the room unusually good. The hotel staff made our stay memorable w/ its efficiency and graciousness! The hotel is at an excellent location--lots of great walking, stores, wonderful park, etc. We were extremely pleased with the hotel staff and location and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: rusty3998
Reviews.Content: I travel for business and choose to stay at the coast plaza on a regular basis. The accomadations are comfortable, location is incredible, clean rooms, friendly staff. Very much a home like atmoshpere and yet has all the ammeneties you could want.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful pet friendly property with warm personable and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: jskokan99
Reviews.Content: You just can`t beat the location of this hotel..situated beside Stanley Park,English Bay allowed us to enjoy nature,fresh air and incredible views after a day of work. The West End is so interesting with great restaurants and it is such a safe place to enjoy a stroll. Its like a resort town within the city. The hotel is older but VERY CLEAN and very friendly. My room had a great new bed and new sliding doors onto the balconey.The hotel continues to improve and invest in their property. Our company will continue to make this property and location our first choice when attending Vancouver for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Lame for marathon runners”
Reviews.Author: MARandJWR
Reviews.Content: We were in Vancouver for the marathon last weekend - this hotel was not awesome for us because they would not extend our checkout time from noon to 2pm. We'd asked in advance if this was possible and the person said that 'it should be no problem'. Well, it was a problem and there was no way around it. It's a nice hotel in a great location, but they were not so awesome when it came to helping us out with the marathon logistics - needless to say, it was stressful and we wished we'd stayed somewhere else. Also, no mini-bar, so no mini fridge to save snacks. Additionally, as an FYI, the only parking option with this hotel is valet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kenbug
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom one and a half bath water view suite with a full kitchen (we reserved a one bedroom suite but were upgraded at no additional cost). The room was located on a corner of the building on the 32nd floor. It had two outdoor balconies with views of Stanley Park to the north and a sunset view of the water to the west. Both views were excellent. The suite itself had a large size living area. Positives: 1. 24 hour reasonably priced room service which included delivery bottles of alcohol. This was great for us because we wanted to make ourselves some mixed drinks but failed to bring along some Vodka. No problem, the room service menu included a large variety of alcohol, a simple phone call and 5 minutes later we were in business. We also ordered breakfast and a late night sandwich and both were excellent. 2. Free van service to downtown area. 3. Super friendly staff. Very nice, very responsive to our requests. 4. Underground on site parking. Check out time at noon, but we were allowed to continue to park until 6:00 p.m. at no additional charge. 5. Nice hotel location close to Stanley Park and beach area. Negatives: 1. Location is cab ride away from downtown area. Can take hotel provided free shuttle but times that this runs are limited. 2. Room furnishings are somewhat dated. Popcorn ceiling in room may bother some. Also, no wide screen flat panel TVs in our room. We did have 2 TVs but they were old square variety with smallish screen. This was no problem for us as we were not there to watch TV but this may bother some. Hotel also has an onsite lounge and restaurant. We didn't visit either but they look nice. Bottom line for us: Loved it! Excellent room views, awesome staff, and nice 24 hour room service menu made this one of our better hotel experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with superb staff”
Reviews.Author: BenfleetFalklands
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Coast Plaza every year for the past six or seven, twice on organised Thomas Cook tours and the rest of the time under our own steam. We have always found the hotel clean and comfortable with spacious rooms. The staff have always been friendly and attentive and nothing seems too much trouble for those working the concierge. The hotel is ideally located for English Bay, Granville Island and Stanley Park. My wife and I have come to regard the Coast Plaza as part of our Vancouver holiday. A good word, too, for the Long Bar which is attached to the hotel. It does some amazing food and drink deals during the week, such as 20 per cent off everything on (I think) every Thursday. The food is great and there's a deal on beer every night. There's live music at at weekends. The staff are great and, as mere tourists, we've always found the locals more than friendly. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific long term stay”
Reviews.Author: plap8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 30 days in Feb and early March at the Coast Hotel taking advantage of their long term stay program, which had, what we thought was an excellent rate for Vancouver. This was actually more than a home away from home experience. The staff couldn’t have been more friendly or helpful. Our one bedroom suite had a king sized bed, large living area and fully equipped kitchen. Our view overlooked Stanley Park and the mountains although we understand that the view on the other side of the hotel of downtown Vancouver is equally impressive. There were guest laundry facilities on the 26th floor as well as a pool, sauna and hot tub in the basement. Hotel guests also had use of the attached fitness centre next door. On the ground floor of the hotel complex was a No Frills grocery store, pharmacy and a discount movie theatre. Guests also received a 30 % discount in the hotel restaurant at night. The location of the hotel made it very conducive for walking. Stanley Park is just 2 blocks from the hotel and we walked the park and seawall often. The promenade along the marina at the north end of Denman Street had excellent views of the mountains and took us all the way to Canada Place. It is a 20 minute walk from the hotel to shopping at Pacific Centre in downtown Vancouver. When we didn’t feel like walking or if it was raining (which it did occasionally, it is Vancouver in winter after all) we took the bus. Transit service in Vancouver is excellent and a discount ticket package was available across the street at 7 Eleven. This location had an endless array of good affordable restaurants to choose from. As an example there are restaurants specializing in Japanese, Mexican, Thai, African, Italian, Greek, Ukrainian and Korean cuisine as well as pizza and burger places. We were seduced in dining out much more than we planned because of the great selection and competitive pricing. The hotel had a great Prime Rib buffet on the weekend and a delicious Indian buffet one night a week. We also enjoyed live music in the lounge one night. Our original intention was to get away from the cold in Manitoba but our stay at this hotel exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: KGill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coast Plaza Hotel for two nights in March 2011. We were looking for a hotel within walking distance of some of Vancouver's parks and restaurants, as we didn't want to bring a car. The Coast Hotel's location is ideal - the beaches of English Bay are minutes away, and the restaurants of Denmand and Robson streets are also within easy strolling distance. Buses that run downtown and to SkyTrain/Canada line are nearby, too. Perfect! The hotel rooms themselves are spacious, and we were happy to have a fridge and microwave. Things are a bit dated, but everything was clean and in working order (the TV reception was a bit fuzzy, though). Unfortunately, the wi-fi network's signal was weak and unusable in our room (1209), so we ended up at the Starbuck's around the corner when we needed to go online. We never saw nor heard anyone from the hotel staff after we checked in (which is a good thing), so no problems there. I'm puzzled by the 'milk and cookies' mentioned by a past reviewer, as I saw no sign of them during our visit. The drugstore and grocery store in the attached mall were convenient, as was the 7-11 across the street. This is a good hotel for people who plan to be out and about, and want to be near some of vancouver's highlights.

Reviews.Title: “Premium Jacuzzi Room is fantastic - check their specials.”
Reviews.Author: misssharon
Reviews.Content: The Premium Jacuzzi Room is gorgeous for a romantic evening away. The jacuzzi is not just a jetted soaker tub like some places - it's a fully tiled area with a deep hot tub in your room that looks out on the city lights. The main area of the spacious room has a desk with two chairs, two sofa style chairs, a television that separates the jacuzzi area from the bed. The furniture and decor is older, but is classy and well-kept enough to not look out-dated. The king bed was very comfortable, with an assortment of pillows and night tables on each side. The closet is decent enough for hanging your wares on their wood hangers. The bathroom is a little small, but you'll be enjoying the jacuzzi anyway. The hotel provides standard toiletries (shampoo, shower gel, lotion) in larger pumps bottles for green practices, as well as smaller-sized service items for you to take with you. Breakfast was excellent. We ordered a Coast breakfast, as well as an Eggs Benedict (our voucher covered two Coast breakfasts but the only charge the additional $1 difference) plus coffee and OJ. It was excellent. The only downer was the morning we were leaving the maid knocked on our door well before check-out three separate times. It was a little annoying in the middle of breakfast, but we could have put out our privacy sign too. If she was wondering if we had already checked out, she should contact the front desk instead of bothering us so many times. But it probably an isolated incident, and wasn't a deterrent to the stay. We bought a Stay, Play and Gourmet package that included a $75 voucher for The Boathouse (excellent resto and walkable), free parking ($25/day normally), and free breakfasts ($30 value). The package costs an extra $50 more than the room so it may be worth seeing if there's one when you're staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Delphin14
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at the Coast Plaza. I had stayed before once. Because I was going to be between homes for a few days, I had needed to find a hotel not only for myself but one that accepted cats and for some reason hotels don't always accept cats. The Coast does! My hotel suite was larger than my apartment! As much as I wanted to move, I almost wished I could just live at the hotel instead! I had a great view of the city and while I stayed there, I felt like it was not only like home but like a refuge from my concerns about work and moving, etc. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “The staff are wonderful and so helpful. Its home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Jack1234504
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, nice and close to lots of good eating places. You can grab food to go and go an sit down at English bay beach and enjoy the always good weather. Or take a stroll along the seawall to Stanley Park

Reviews.Title: “Ah, it's good to be home.”
Reviews.Author: advertisingjb43
Reviews.Content: I liked my stay so much I came back. Then I extended my stay. It is a great location and the hotel staff are always helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff”
Reviews.Author: travelerbob_11
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Coast a lot and find that the location is superb as it is just slightly off the downtown core--walking distance--and the West End is like a world unto itself. I have to also say that the staff are great and are always ready to help/suggest with anything you need. And I can bring my dog!

Reviews.Title: “A true West Coast Experience”
Reviews.Author: 1tractorguy
Reviews.Content: Just spend the weekend in Vancouver and loved this Hotel. The weather didn’t cooperate, but the great views from our room overlooking English Bay and North shore Mountains more than made up for that. We did most of our sightseeing …right from our room, which was really comfortable and made for a relaxing stay. Right in the heart of the Bay this Hotel location met all of our needs we didn’t even bother with the car the whole time. The Brasserie Restaurant had wonderful menu choices and the service was most attentive and really friendly. Great Pub too. Want to get to know life on the West Coast, start here!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel! Incredible People!”
Reviews.Author: jbeltrano
Reviews.Content: Our home away from home! This hotel consistently delivers exceptional service, product and experience. The people are amazing and send my accolades to each everyone of them! Thank you for making us feel like we are at home. Joey & Kelly

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reidking
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Coast Plaza many times and it is the very best hotel I have ever stayed at. I travel a lot across Canada and the U.S. and stay in hotels in every city. The Coast is , very simply, the best place I stay. The service is above and beyond. It is a lot like Disneyland it is "the happiest place on earth"

Reviews.Title: “I travel to Vancouver several times a year and I always stay here!”
Reviews.Author: brianb44
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vancouver at least 6 times a year and I always stay at the Coast. The service is prompt and friendly and the staff are all pleasant. Food in the restaurants is decent and the rooms are well appointed. The best feature of this hotel is the views of English Bay from the rooms, spectacular! Close to the beach and plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. Convenient to almost all locations in downtown Vancouver. Definitely a must stay location while in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend!”
Reviews.Author: mahastings
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a very comfortable 2 bedroom suite that was vey large. Was great to have a fully eguiped kitchen so we did not have to eat out all the time.Having a grocery store right at hotel was a bonus as we just had to go downstairs to get what we wanted. Living room was large so entertaining was comfortable and the veiws from all rooms was amazing. We were there for a family birthday and found everything to our satisfaction and can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “All Around Bad”
Reviews.Author: YanksFan83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Vancouver with another couple. We decided to grab two rooms on Priceline and opted to focus on trying to get the Coast Plaza Suits since it was reasonable and "downtown." Well, the price was OK at like $65 after tax, but the hotel was terrible. Location is poor. Far from everything but the overrated Stanley Park. The customer service was worse. Unhelpful and in their own worlds, numerous people behind the desk were clueless about a mistake Priceline made (they double charged), currency exchange, and parking. The concierge, however, was very nice and helpful. The rooms are huge, but there was hair on our shower wall, the coffee was terrible, and the beds were not comfortable. Oh, it was winter and very cold and the heat didn't work unless you could put up with a terrible buzzing sound coming from the temperate control. Overall, I wouldn't stay at this place for free with so many other options in the city. This is my second Coast Hotel, and both were equally bad. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but could use some sound proofing.”
Reviews.Author: KLEwing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our birthday weekend. We wanted something near Stanley Park but not too far from the downtown core. Also, we got a good rate (less that $150 per night) at this place. The hotel is located in a residential area about 5 blocks from the entrance to Stanley Park. Its also about 4 blocks to English Bay (?) which has a beach and boardwalk. It is part of a larger complex with a movie theater, grocery store, and drug store on the ground floor. There are tons of restaurants and cafes right there. We stayed two nights in a 2 bedroom corner suite on the 29th floor. The views were amazing and the room was great, although a little dated. It had 1 3/4 bathrooms, a living room, 2 bedrooms, 2 balconies, a full kitchen (stove/oven, microwave, dishes, dish washer, a full sized fridge), and a large living room. The couch in the living room pulled out into a bed. Drawbacks: We are pretty sure we heard the people above us using the bathroom. Icky! I thought $25 per night for parking was a little steep. We ordered breakfast from room service which wasn't too expensive, but wasn't very good. Even though everything else in the kitchen is full sized, the coffee pot was a little 4 cup'er. Also, the swimming pool is in the basement/parking garage. We didn't use it. It should be noted that the owners of the property have applied to turn the hotel rooms into rental apartments and the conference rooms into office space. So, who knows how long it will remain a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is amazing”
Reviews.Author: debcanada23
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for a few days and I must say I had a pleasant experience. There was constructions going on so that was the only downfall. Front desk staff for the most part were great, I dealt mostly with Dan and he was extremely helpful and went above and behind to ensure we had a pleasant stay. Also the bell staff were tremendous as they recommended some great restaurants! We will be coming back mostly because of the great location and first class service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & views. Needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: savarygal
Reviews.Content: When we travel to the lower mainland, we stay at the Coast in Tsawwassen, however, my parents live near the Coast Plaza and we thought we'd give this hotel a try. With recommendation from Reservations, we booked in a 1 bedroom suite with my Coast Rewards and were looking forward to staying at the hotel due to it having a separate bedroom with a king sized bed. Our 4 year old daughter sleeps with us while we travel and it's nice if we can have a separate bedroom after she's gone to bed. To sum up: We will never stay at this hotel again and will book at the Coast Tsawwassen Inn in the future.
