Saving grace for this stay was the service staff who were exceptional and the front desk staff very courteous and accommodating. They quickly reversed the parking ticket we received (we weren't supposed to be ticketed for a paid spot!). Parking was okay and be mindful if you need assistance with stairs as there is a set of stairs down to the hotel level after you've parked your car. Not an issue for us, but I am cognizant of accessibility issues and tend to notice these things. Parking is expensive (again, another plus for the Coast Tsawwassen as it's free there) at $25.00 per day. Once we went into the room, I felt it was in desperate need of an upgrade, however, for the deal we got for the room ($119 per night), I was pleased with the space and layout. Kitchen was functional, if not a lot older in decor. The balcony was very nice to have, but when my 4 year old went outside, she found a large deposit of cigarette butts! ACK! When I went to go complain to the front desk (I do not normally fuss when I am in a hotel), I noticed the box spring on the mattress was HORRENDOUS. There was some kind of red stain on it and I was SO turned off. I realize it was likely a spilled glass of wine, but good grief... HIDE IT at least from view! We called the front desk and they moved us to another room immediately, which was very much the same as the previous one, however, clean balcony (and cleaner box spring). We were happy with how quiet it was from road noise and really enjoyed the city/water views from the balcony/windows. Then came night. My 4 year old and my husband will sleep through anything and I am usually pretty good, however, I could not sleep a wink in this room due to the noise from the elevator!!! Just as I'd drift off, that elevator would rumble and grind. It was not quiet in the slightest. I phoned the front desk around 2 AM after giving up trying to sleep and they apologized and explained that ALL the suites run beside the elevator shafts and that the elevator was particularly busy that night due to some teams checking in late. She did say that they'd get the elevator close to our room shut off for the rest of the night, but that it would resume at 6 AM. And it did. I managed about 3 hours sleep that night. Shame really, because the room was more than suitable. In the morning, the front desk moved us to a Jr. Suite that was removed from the elevator shaft and offered us to look at a 2 bedroom suite that was also removed from the elevators (thought all suites ran alongside the elevator???) and had a remarkable view from two balconies! Those two rooms were far more updated than the two we had been in. We settled on the Jr. Suite as the 2 bedroom would be much too much room for us. It was absolutely perfect and lovely. The beds were not that comfortable (two doubles, no king), but it was quiet. There wasn't a sep. bedroom, but the room was rather large with a sep. sitting area. The pool was nice and hot tub decent, however, we were totally grossed out by someone's leftover, rather awfully stained, underwear right by the stairs to the hot tub. One thing I didn't like was that we had to pay more money for the Jr. Suite; I felt the hotel should have absorbed that cost due to the fact that when I initially called to book the suite, I mentioned that it must be quiet and we didn't care if it was away from any views as long as we'd get a good night's rest. When I complained about the elevator noise, they said they'd had LOTS of complaints about that. Oh well, lessons learned. We won't be back there again - for us, the Tsawwassen Inn wins hands down in price, amenities, and quality of room. Worth it, even with the drive! Restaurant was exceptional. Food was more than delicious and proximity to the mall underground and popular Vancouver streets was excellent. I highly recommend eating breakfast at the restaurant or down the street at Milestones. Room service was good too and quick. I do not think I'd recommend this hotel and the only reason my rating will be higher than it should is because the service was great and the location superb. I would NEVER book this hotel at its full price and even with our half-off room rates deal, I still feel we paid more than we should have.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, both in value and service”
Reviews.Author: Yearlytraveller_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at hotel. Found service extremely friendly and helpful. Comfort Room was spacious and clean and we appreciated the walk-out balcony. We used the concierge service several times and found this most informative and helpful. We had breakfast in The Brasserie every day and the food was exellent and good value. Waiting staff were very attentive. All in all, the hotel was great value for money, in a great location. We would definitely stay there again when visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing! No 3.5 star”
Reviews.Author: sspc
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs a complete overall. The rooms have a smell, the tub and sink is left over from the 70s. The sheets are rough, the furniture needs replacing, etc. It's suppose to be a suite hotel, it is not. The room is slightly larger than normal, but still not a suite. The best thing about this hotel is the location, it's connected to a mall, and the neighborhood is good for walking. Avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean,fluffy towels and bath robes”
Reviews.Author: Pauline077
Reviews.Content: Just before leaving for our holiday I had another look at reviews and some of the more recent ones had me a little worried.On arrival very pleasent check in and we had been upgraded to a suite ,as it was our 30th Wedding Anniversary.as some other reviews stated , room needed redecorating,very 80's and rather dark.we were at the back and high up, so overlooked buildings but felt good as no other tall buildings near.Plenty of room,lounge/ small kitchen area/decent size bedroom/small bathroom.All nice and clean .They still hadn't quite finished replacing windows but didn't bother us as they were below us,just mean't balcony was very dusty and you couldn't go out during the day but as we were out, didn't bother us.Breakfast was good,continental but plenty of it,mostly nice staff.we stayed 3 nights and then returned for 1 more, a week later ,this time upgraded to Superior ,same sort of decor but this time we overlooked the harbour which was really nice.I would say don't worry ,it's clean , just rather old fashioned decor and a little dark .Just don't let that spoil your time there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, though needs upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Olino
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the beginning and end of our round trip of Western Canada. The hotel is in an excellent location in the West End of Downtown Vancouver, a short walk from Stanley Park, the harbour or English Bay Beach. Staff were friendly and helpful. Currently, the hotel is in the process of replacing all windows which causes some noise, especially since work starts at 8am - though we were informed of this in advance. The furniture and bathroom fittingds are somewhat dated and require updating. Breakfast was included in our package, and was actually not bad, certainly a good start to the day. All in all a good compromise, because you can live with the downsides and have a great starting point for discovering this beautiful city. Ask for a room in one of the higher floors, as you'll enjoy a great view of either Downtown/harbour or the Bay...!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff and Location.”
Reviews.Author: ST1951
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in 2009 and booked to stay there again for eight nights in September 2010. I have just returned and, having read the review by tripped70 below I wonder if I stayed at the same hotel! There are two sides to every story and it would be interesting to have the hotel's version of the events he describes. I could not fault the hotel or the staff. From the moment I arrived everyone I encountered was most courteous and helpful. Firstly let's deal with the work taking place at the hotel. This was absolutely no problem at all. As it took place between 8.00 and 4.30 it did not disturb me. I usually got back to the hotel around 3.00 most days and never heard anything. The hotel is in a great location. It is only a stones throw from English Bay. Getting into the heart of downtown is not a problem in view of the frequent bus service. It was great to have a walk round the bay at night in view of the atmosphere. A lot of people seem to go there to chill out and watch the sunset. Wonderful! There is a good bar attached to the hotel and several others in the location. Most of the popular bars etc seem to be in Yaletown. Again, very easy to get to in view of the good bus service. I had a room on the 32nd floor. I am obsessed with getting a good nights sleep and I never heard a sound! The view over the City was magnificent. The receptionist apologised for not giving me a room overlooking English Bay. Frankly, I prefered the city view which, at night, was stunning. The room was large, clean and I cannot think of any issues worthy of comment. Other reviewers have mentioned the need for some renovation of the rooms. This was not a problem for me. There were two double beds and plenty of space for a sitting area. There was also a fridge and coffee making facilities. Large patio windows opened out onto a balcony. Unfortunately I never ventured on to it in view of my fear of heights! The complimentary Wi Fi was fine. The speed was always above 1Mb and I was able to Skype without any problem. There was no safe in the room but I was allocated a complimentary deposit box at reception. Getting access to it was not a problem. A continental breakfast was included in the price I paid for the room. Whilst there was also a full breakfast menu I found the continental breakfast to be perfectly adequeate. Cereal, cooked meats, cheeses, yoghurt, pastries etc plus the usual juices and coffee. Servers continually circulated with coffee refills. I had to queue for a table on a couple of days in view of a large party staying at the hotel who all seemed to want breakfast together. I only had to wait a few minutes for a table. Transferring from the airport was a doddle. I took the Canada Line to Yaletown Roundhouse and the C23 bus from outside the station to Bidwell St. It was only a short walk to the hotel. A lot cheaper than a taxi and probably as quick. The taxi may, however, be the better option if there are a couple of people with heavy cases. I had an excellent stay at the hotel and cannot think of anything adverse to comment on. I would certainly recommend it and, if I return to Vancouver, I will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute waste of my time and money.”
Reviews.Author: tripped70
Reviews.Content: I obtained this room through PriceLine. Arrived at hotel and was told that I could not park on the street without a residential permit; advised this by parking attendant. So, parked in underground parking ($27.00 a night). Took bags upstairs to register. Asked front desk clerk if they would comp me the parking fee (normal request; rarely denied - in my experience). Clerk immediately went on the attack and assumed a haughty tone, "What's the problem?" she demanded. I told her there wasn't a problem, I was simply making a request. She then told me that "everyone" pays for parking and I should have parked on the street if I didn't want to pay for the parking. I advised her that I had been informed that I could not park on the street without a permit. She said that it was my "choice" to park downstairs so I would have to pay for the parking and it wasn't the hotel's garage so it wasn't their problem. I responded by telling her that if guests who "choose" to park there are doing so on the basis of being misinformed about the parking permit situation, the hotel should be very concerned. She then reluctantly, and rudely, agreed to comp my parking and made a big deal out of telling me very loudly what a great favour she was doing me. She then gave me a room key and told me there was "some" construction going on at the hotel. After some discussion she gave me keys to 02 rooms; one on the 9th floor, one on the 11th floor. I went to the 9th floor and found a room that smelled stale and that was located DIRECTLY ABOVE the construction site. So, I went to check out the room on the 11th floor. That room had a run down kitchen area attached and was above and adjacent to yet another construction area. So I went down to the front desk and asked for another room. She initally told me she had no other room, then when I challenged her and said, you have 33 floors of rooms and you don't have a SINGLE ROOM available that isn't above or beside the construction area? She finally gave in and called the concierge. Still, she refused to give me another key, instead, calling over the concierge to ESCORT me to a 3rd room and then, before I had even left the front desk area, she was on the phone with someone - speaking loudly and making sure all guests heard her comments - telling this person at the other end of the phone to CHECK THE ROOMS I had been in to make sure that they were "still okay". Really? Really? Like what would I have done in the less than 5 minutes I was gone? Destroyed the rooms? It seemed clear to me that her intent was to humilate me and embarrass me and punish me for asking for a decent room. I went to the room on the 10th floor which was marginally better than the one the 9th floor. Still, hair in the tub and sticky spill stains on the table and a TV a great distance from the bed. Toilet that ran almost all night (stopping spontaneously at about 4 a.m.). Horrible. Absolutely horrible. Unbelievable. Shameful. Shame on Coast Hotels and this site in particular. Have stayed in other Coast facilities and always with good customer service and quality rooms. This was a nightmare. If you pay more than $25.00 for a room at this dump, you have been ripped off. Enjoy the construction and the noise and the dust and the vibrations and the attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: RedDeerian
Reviews.Content: The room was a small apartment - approx. 900 square feet with two bedrooms, one and a half baths, and two large patios with glass doors. We loved the spaciousness and having a reasonably stocked kitchen (utensils & such, not food) came in handy often. The rooms are fabulous - if you appreciate early 90's decor - so if you're looking for something modern and posh this may not be the hotel for you. However, it was perfect for us travelling with a five year old. The room was kept clean and my husband was in love with the turn down service, who brought ice nightly. Also, the pool was good as was free wifi. The other notable about the rooms were the views. We were on the 29th floor and the views we had were amazing. In fact, we were able to watch the PNE Parade from our patio. Currently, they are working on the patios and windows so during the week we often had company on our patios but usually we were gone during the day, so no biggie. (One morning my husband was amazed to see a guy hanging by just a rope and tiny seat working on the patio beside us.) Also, The location was great, three blocks from the beach, a short walk to Stanley Park and Robson Street. We had a great vacation here and will definitely stay in this hotel again when in Vancouver. NOTE - The parkade located underneath the hotel has REALLY LOW clearances (6'1"). If you drive a higher vehicle (we have a Ford Expedition) you may want to park in another lot they have on the other side (accessed off Nelson St). We got into the parkade really slowly and precariously but had issues getting out. It wasn't until we almost took out a pipe that the parking guy told us about the other lot.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: EssexTripster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the English Bay area, which is a very lively part of Vancouver. The Seawall walk begins just a few minutes from this hotel, so is ideally located close to Stanley Park. The reception was very modern and the staff were very welcoming and helpful. Our room was in need of an update as there was a lack of lighting, however the room was very large, spacious and clean. The swimming pool was a reasonable size and there was plenty of space and lounge areas in the hotel. There is also a garden outside with plenty of seating. Overall, we were pleased with our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Coast Plaza Hotel Vancouver  We booked...”
Reviews.Author: mafootje
Reviews.Content: Coast Plaza Hotel Vancouver  We booked this hotel through priceline. Don't know if the low rate compared to the rate on THE hotel website had anything to do with it but the room location wasn't very good.  It was located on THE 8th floor right next to the roof filled with large airco units. They made noise during THE day and night. Rooms themself where large but outdated. THE beds where good but blankets need some replacement. Kitchen had a refrigerator with freezer and à microwave. Enough closet space available in THE room. There's no safe in THE room. Parking can be done underneath THE hotel but the fee is $25 per night. Location is great near THE waterfront and city center. Nice place for running along THE water and THE park. Roomrate is not good compared to quality of rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great location - dont let current renovations put you off”
Reviews.Author: CathYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights in total - at beginning and end of a trip in 2 different rooms and found everything to be very good - views are fabulous. Breakfast service was swift.. Service was good - when maintenance needed to access our room to fix a fuse problem in a neighbouring room they compensated us with a bottle of wine - hardly necessary but a nice touch. Yes there is building work going on from 8-5 but as we were out all day this didnt matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and they fix problems”
Reviews.Author: hardendorf
Reviews.Content: I was set to stay here my last night in Vancouver. Aside from the construction work everything was fine. The neighborhood is wonderful couldn't have picked a better place for my last night. Then our air conditioning failed ( and this was during a heat wave and the hotel was a full capacity) they spent a good bit of time on it and did their best. Not being able to remedy the situation they paid for a cab to their airport location and covered the full cost. This worked out great since I was flying out the next morning. So I ended up having the best of both worlds a fun day in West End then being able to wake up near the airport with a free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: choirgirlcalifornia
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Vancouver. I choose this hotel because the reviews were good from other "trip advisor" travelers. First, the location was not downtown. If you want that, don't stay there. Having said that, being located on the west end was great! The hotel is in a neighborhood surrounded by homes, stores and restaurants. We walked to get dinner and it was only a few blocks from the ocean and the "hop-on-hop-off" bus, which we like to take. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly and helpful. They have an "office" to use for a fee, but I asked if I could check my emails and they let me do it several times with no charge. Our room was very, very large. The beds were very comfortable, it was quiet and we had a great view. Every room has a great view. Before we left, we went up to the 39th floor to see the view. The conference room doors were locked, but some maintenance staff who walked in were kind enough to show us the view. What a treat it was!!! I say we would stay there again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Large suites, easy access to everything...”
Reviews.Author: Caro281
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work purposes. I didn't have a choice in regards to which hotel I would be staying at or what kind of room I would be booked into. I was pleasantly surprised at the roominess of the suite. My husband and daughter tagged along and my daughter loved the space to run around in. The hotel seems to be mid-renovations where the windows are being replaced (thank goodness b/c the sirens sound like they could be directly outside our window even 18 stories up), the carpet is newer, and some of the furniture also looked relatively new. The bathrooms are older but very clean so I can't really complain. The kitchen was large but was missing utensils. We had free internet, and the pool according to my family was good too. There are separate saunas in each locker room which was different and I got a chuckle out of the sign that said, "Clothes must be worn at all times" outside the sauna door. What I really liked about this hotel is that there is a tiny mall underneath the hotel that has a small no frills grocery store and a drugstore. I think this would be handy for anyone staying here wanting to cut costs. There are also lots of restaurants up and down the road in front of the hotel. One thing that I didn't care for was the sound of the elevators going up and down while in the bedroom. At first I thought it was a plane overhead but then realized it had to be the elevators since we were not near the airport and virtually stopped in the middle of the night. Lastly, the squirrels stealing nuts left out by I imagine the workers at the hotel was very entertaining while waiting for a taxi in the morning. Oh, I didn't use the gym myself but I checked it out. The gym is privately owned/run by someone other than the hotel but guests get free use of the gym. If I had time I would have loved to use it or take a class. If you like to work out while staying at a hotel I think this place would be perfect as it isn't your typical teeny weeny 'gym' with an old treadmill and a bike.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location, excellent value, walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: mcqker
Reviews.Content: Free wi-fi; great views, three blocks to the beach and the seawall walk, dozens of restaurants right on Denman Street, grocery store and drug store in the first floor of the building, adjacent gym open to hotel guests, full kitchen in our room, two tvs - one in the living room and one in the bedroom. Within walking distance of Stanley Park, Robson Street shopping, and downtown malls. Parking was $10-12 per night in the underground garage. Our only complaint was the noise in our room - the headboard of our bed was against the wall by the elevator shaft, so we heard the elevator every time it went past our floor. We tried to move rooms - the staff was very nice about it - but every one-bedroom suite is next to the elevator shaft. If you get a one-bedroom suite, try to request a high floor. Also, the windows are single-paned, so ambient street noise can be heard - not bad, but noticable - but while we were there, they were working on replacing windows on some floors, so it's possible that issue has been fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: CupcakeFanatic999
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting Vancouver for leisure, this hotel is the perfect base for your stay! It's located in the West End neighborhood, near Stanley Park. There are tons of restaurants and shops all around the hotel. The hotel itself features spacious rooms with lots of natural light and a view of the city. The hotel is attached to a small mall with a grocery store, gym, pharmacy, wine store, salon, and other services. We took advantage of the gym and hot tub. The staff was wonderful in accomodating our requests promptly and answering our questions about the city. The decor definitely has an outdated 1980's vibe, but it's purely cosmetic. The hotel seems to be making changes, as they were starting the replacement of all the windows in the tower. We explored the city for 3 days and decided the West End was the best neighborhood to be based out of for the duration of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: brodyn97
Reviews.Content: We are actually still here and because of the free internet, I am able to write this from the hotel. Not too many hotel's have complimentary wireless internet anymore. I've stayed at hotel's that charge up to $10 per day! So our trip is going beyond our expectations. We only ran into one bump so far and that had to do with the hotel needed to fix a power issue. They offered to put us up at a sister hotel for the weekend but instead we decided to rent a car for the weekend so we can make sure we are not here during the repairs. (They have to shut the power off while they are fixing the problem only during the day) They upgraded our room at their expense to make up for the issue and offered to pay the $23 parking for the rental. Which made me quite happy because we would have not needed the rental if it hadn't been for the power issue. Never the less, they have more then made up for it. The people at the front desk are beyond helpful and very friendly! I think this is far beyond a 3 1/2 star hotel. Other then the appliances are very outdated....but really...who goes on vacation with intenstions of cooking anything anyways? I'm more then happy to have a fridge and having a microwave for heating up leftovers is a bonus! Beds are very comfy and clean. Bathroom is good enough. Overall, very great! Oh, the location is perfect. Close enough to walk downtown if you are up for a nice 20 minute walk but very very close to the beach, Stanley Park or over to the water taxi's to go to Granville Island! Hope you enjoy! You must try Knight and Day Restaurant for breakfast and also accross the street is a little Greek restaurant called Maria's Taverna....best greek food I ever had!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Quality”
Reviews.Author: DZanovitch
Reviews.Content: We were able to walk to the beach and to Stanley park no problem. WONDERFUL views, night and day. Will definately try to stay here again. This hotel is in the International district so you can find some good not too far away. Indoor pool simple yet ample room for swimming laps.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: Washingtonwanderers
Reviews.Content: Did not have the higest of expectations for our stay at this hotel as it is not a beautiful buidling, but the staff treated us exceptionally and the view was UNBELIEVABLE. I really did not know that there was a place in Vancouver that you could see False Creek, English Bay, and Coal Harbour. We had our dog and there is a great dog walking area a block from the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; tired furnishings”
Reviews.Author: embarkcdn
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a name your price website for what I consider a value hotel. The location is excellent with many restaurants and shops nearby; there are two Safeways, a Tim Horton's, and English Bay within walking distance. The most critical part of the hotel is the shabby furnishings. The hotel had several decades to refresh the rooms. I suspect most of the furnishing was from the early 80's. Here are other features: Parking is available for $23 CAD per day with in/out privileges. Wifi is free throughout the hotel but requires a passcode for each session.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ina great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Imbatman
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Vancouver Plaza back in October. I was in Vancouver on business and for the U2 concert. I have to say that the Plaza is great place to stay. The rooms are a little dated, but the service was excellent. I found the bellmen to be professional and hard working. My expectations were met. The hotel also has the added benefit of being in a great neighborhood with interested stores and restaurants. The view from the floor that I stayed on was stunning. I'd love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very outdated & smelly comforter”
Reviews.Author: travel_addict_bb
Reviews.Content: comforter smells really bad (like clothes left over night in washer). 15 to 20 minutes walk away from robson shopping district. very inconvience location for someone w/o car. I coughed the entire time while I'm in the room (very bad odor came from the bed sheets & comforter). Luckily only stayed two nights so I didn't bother to switch room. Very rude bell man. Limited light in the room. Dirty, smelly, & outdated room. Overall, find other places to stay if I return to Vancouver for vacation. Other than roomy. Nothing good about this hotel. Hotel parking for $19/night (CAD). Ridiculous, bad reception wireless. I could not log on the wireless network at all. If I did successfully logged on the wireless, it would logged off immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. HUGE Room”
Reviews.Author: HabsFan21
Reviews.Content: I agree with everyone else, the decor is dated, but the rooms are HUGE! Great views, close to Stanley Park and English bay. Very Clean.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RockymtnsAlberta
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel thro' Priceline for $ 75 per night. Althought the furniture is somewhat dated, the location is excellent. Round the corner from shops and numerous restaurants and a 2 mins. walk to the Seawall. Staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller911
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel very dated, the room had a portable A/C, had a view of an alley. Tried to watch a movie and the movie box didnt work and the front desk couldnt help. Really not impressed at all. For the amount it costs there are much better places to stay in downtown van.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Book Coast Plaza Hotel & Suites Any Place They Are”
Reviews.Author: Dembies
Reviews.Content: We received a warm welcome at the desk even though our ship came in early in the morning. We were given a high floor as I had requested. The suite was lovely--spaciaous, well-appointed (even to the Q-tips), had a great balcony and view, and was very comfortable. It was serviced well. The concierge helped us with our tours, maps, etc. On the last day we were both sick. When the housekeeper came to the door, I said we would pass, and she insisted that she at least stock us with additional coffee, tea, and accompaniments. The staff took a personal interest in guests. It was a great stay. This hotel is in a perfect location--3 blocks from Sunset Beach, and amid a plethora of great international restaurants and seafood houses. Terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and great service”
Reviews.Author: PG_Coach
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that I have stayed at this hotel in the last 8 months and it is quickly becoming a favorite of mine. The rooms are not the best, but the beds are comfy and the rooms are very clean. If you are lucky enough you can get a room that has an awesome view of the ocean. The best part of this hotel is that you are incredibly close to the seawall and English Bay. If you run, this is awesome news. There are countless choices for food and shopping all within a 5 minute walk. The hotel does have a business centre which is nice for checking email and printing documents. The pool is nice. Very clean and well maintained. I will definitely stay here again for business.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Blunder!”
Reviews.Author: hollywashington
Reviews.Content: I had reserved a suite with a jacuzzi tub for our anniversary evening. Not staying here before I had looked on their website and viewed the picture for the room we were to stay in. Unfortunately they had only one picture which was that of the tub. It was nicely remodeled with beautfiul tile and you could see the view from the picture. Wow were we suprised when we arrived. Everything was horribly outdated and looked unclean. The bathroom was so small you could barely move. The curtains and comforter were horribly ugly and looked like they haven't been changed since the 70s. The state of the furniture was used and old. I was very dissapointed as we had paid 300 dollars for this room. It was not lovely I would never recommend this for anyone else, regardless of the convenience of location. And with some of the amenities, they did have wi-fi which barely worked and was sporadic, the pool was on the very bottom floor and not pleasant, the parking was easily accessable but cost us 18 dollars a night which was way too expensive, and when we called for a bottle opener it took all night for them to get it right to send someone up for it. We almost had to go to the front desk to find one.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel 2.5km from centre of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: red1stoney
Reviews.Content: Once inside this hotel, it has most things that you need from a holiday hotel - bar, restaurant, free wi-fi, pool etc - the hotel rooms are somewhat old and dated. Whilst the hotel is situated within reasonable walking distance distance of the main centre of Vancouver (30 mins walk) and the False Creek area (15 mins walk), Denman Street is not somewhere that I would recommend single travellers being alone in at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for 5 + 1”
Reviews.Author: GMforever
Reviews.Content: After leaving Victoria. we added one more kid to our group and headed by ferry to Vancouver. The Coast Plaza is very well located for family travel. Turn right on Denman and you are in Stanley Park. Turn left and you are on the English Bay beach. We even went swimming and slide in the Pacific, the weather was gorgeous. We had a large suite on the 33 rd floor: what a view!. Too bad we had to leave before the fireworks on Wednesdays. 2 rooms, a kitchen, a large living room, a small dining room. Plenty of space for the 6 of us. We had no problem with the portable AC. As mentionned in other posts, the decor, especially the kitchen, is dated but the place is very clean. The beds were not as confortable than in Victoria and there was a bit more noise ( from the street instead of the seagulls ) but we slept well . We had a few nice attentions: chocolates and a turn down service at night, gifts for the kids.I think you can also borrow rackets and stuff for the beach. The staff was very nice and helpful. Through the concierge, you can obtain rebate coupons for certain attractions. If you have kids, the Vancouver Aquarium is a must see and you can walk there from the hotel. Other fun places are Playland , the Science center and the Burnaby village ( you will need a car ) We used the kitchen every day. WiFi Internet is free and works well There is a parking and a pool. Also the hotel connects to a mall and there is another supermarket on Denman and Robson. The neighborhood is trendy with a tons of restaurants on Denman ( Malaysian, Mongolian BBQ, Sushi, Fish and Chips, Korean, French and so on ...) It is also a residential area which makes up for a nice vibe If you go, I recommend you to look at the hotel Web site, which offers different packages. Ours included 25$ a day food credit, free parking and gifts . We did not try the 2 restaurants at the hotel On a more personnal note, we appreciated that the Coast Plaza Hotel sponsors a young springboard diver from Vancouver, as two of my kids and myself are divers also

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the heart of west end Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: Globe_Trotter1991
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 2 weeks at the beginning of August 2008, as mentioned on a few of the other reviews it can be argued that the rooms could be considered slightly dated, however the rooms are extremely clean and well kept and the decor of the rooms can easily be looked over because of this. The hotel is in a magnificent location on Denman street near English Bay. This is one of the most trendy and happening places in vancouver and the restaurant scene just outside the hotels front door is very diverse, with cuisine from Greece, Malaysia and Canada available (I personally recommend the Raincity Grill.) The staff in the hotel are amazingly friendly and efficient, I arrived from the airport around 1pm, fully aware that check-in was not available until 3pm, the staff apologized for this and offered me free drinks in the hotel bar!! Throughout my trip I had assistance planning excursions to Victoria and Whistler and a bus to seattle which was organised swiflty and professionaly by the hotel concierge. I had the pleasure of staying in a superior suite which was the largest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Although I didn't use the kitchen it was well equipped and large, for hotel standards, and would be a huge advantage if anyone was considering self catering on their holiday. Adjacent to the Denman Place Mall, it is easy enough to have a quick trip to the supermarket or pharmacy to get anything you may need All in all this was a fantastic hotel in a fantastic location in vancouver, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: harlan8
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here since 2002. I love the location. Certain rooms have the best view in the town. There is a grocery store in the shopping center on the 1st floor (good when I was sick and went down for some soup), gym attached. I love Denman St. and English Bay. There are so many terrific ethnic restaurants and it is 2 blocks to the beach, English Bay and Stanley Park. So anytime of year, you walk out and are in a great , beautiful place, not like the downtown hotels. I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: travellersyarn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coast Plaza and Suites after flying from Hong Kong, and were pleasantly suprised by the size of the rooms in our 2 bedroom suite with kitchen. The kitchen was huge, and the living room had plenty of space for the kids to play. The staff at the Coast Plaza and Suited were helpful, and the location of the hotel is amazing, walking distance to the beach and Stanley Pqark, and with a supermarket and drug store downstairs. While the furnishings are not fancy, they were entireley suitable for a family travelling with small children. The room service was fast and the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: sherrywheeler
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver for the Federal Liberal Convention and stayed at this well located coast hotel.It is in a charming neigbourhood and the service was friendly and efficient.We had a view of English Bay and the room was well appointed and maintained.We had a small refrigerator and the beds were very comfortable. I will stay here again on future trips to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location, large rooms, views on most floors”
Reviews.Author: HJG
Reviews.Content: This hotel will do if your not looking for modern and find on discount web site. Just find 3.5 star on hot wire in Stanley Park area and you'll get this hotel. nice "locals" area. Walk to many 20 resturants in all price ranges within a couple of blocks. Live music @ hotel sports bar on Saturdays was better than expected. Easy inexpensive taxi ride most anywhere in downtown vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good position for Stanley Park, rather dated, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Europamonkey
Reviews.Content: The location is good for Stanley Park, a few blocks away, and for Robson St (the main shopping street). Granville Island and areas such as Yaletown, Gastown and Chinatown are perhaps up to 30 minutes walking distance. Check-in was quick, friendly and efficient, as was check-out. We had a Priceline deal (so a fully prepaid reservation) of $59 per night. The room was on the 14th floor, not very high up, but still with a good view from the balcony. It was spacious with double twin beds, but the decor was somewhat dated. The bathroom had a brown bath (white sink and toilet), and some chipped floor tiles. That said, the shower was fine, and the room was very clean. Room facilities included a fridge (no mini-bar), coffee maker, iron/ironing board, and TV. The pool was 46 ft long and appeared well kept although heavily chlorinated. The adjacent hot tub was rather small, but suitably hot. There was also a sauna in the changing room (not used, so can't comment). Free wi-fi was available in the room with a password from reception, and we had no problems with it. The lift descended below lobby level to the underground shopping mall with access from outside, and therefore security is a concern; the room key card was only required to access the lift after midnight. We had a comfortable stay for three nights, and have no complaints for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service but rooms need a make over”
Reviews.Author: nikki_raven
Reviews.Content: I once again rolled the dice with Hot wire and this came up. I was impressed with the location -so many restaurants and attractions (Stanley Park & Eng Bay) The lobby and staff were very professional. The room was very large with a separate area with a couch and . chair an table and it even had a kitchen. But it looked like it was from the 60's/70's and needed an upgrade. There was a business center open 24 hours which was just what i needed to print some very important paperwork . The elevators were quick and check out was fast . OOOOOh and free wireless internet !! YEAH!!! I was going to stay another night but the rates had almost tripled from what i paid with Hot wire . So off i went to an even NICER hotel (see other recent review )

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Amy256
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Coast Plaza on Comox Street for one night; Friday. It was our first stay at this hotel and I found the location one block from Stanley Park and on English Bay excellent. Our room was 3004 very spacious with a seperate seat area with couch and chair. A proper table and chairs were available for dining had we brought something in along with a fridge and coffee station. The hotel is older but I found it very clean and everything in good working order. Went for a swim and enjoyed the pool. We had supper at the Bistro which was disappointing but with all the interesting restaurants in the imediate area there are lots of great options for all tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Johnnysch
Reviews.Content: Located in the English Bay area of central Vancouver, this hotel offers spacious, quiet rooms, some with kitchen, great views, Internet (check for cabled connection, the wireless does not work well everywhere) and parking (add.cost). I found the room service breakfast better than the hotel restaurant. And if you like a stroll in the morning, the walk along English Bay is a great way to start the day! Pool and spa are OK but heavily chlorinated.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location, Clean and Solid.”
Reviews.Author: mjgriffy
Reviews.Content: I booked my room last minute through an engine where you don't know the hotel until you pay for it (you know which one I mean). A frequent visitor to Vancouver, I had never stayed here before and was completely pleased have paid less than seventy five USD. It is in the far west end of the West End, nearest to Stanley Park. Walking distance to Robson, Davie, the Park and waterfront, but a stretch to Granville, Yaletown, etc. Situated in a residential (condo/apt) area of the West End, it was particularly quiet and tranquil. Being a concrete and steel highrise, it was even more so quiet. The check in was fast, friendly and efficient. The room was large (500sft), and provided two queen beds, a kitchen, full bath, seating area, and walk-out balcony. All furnishing were solid and clean, but certainly dated. I don't mind the age, as long as it is clean and works. The free WiFi did not perform well. I perused the pictures of other guests on here, and my room was similar to everyone else's. All in all, a great value and good place especially if under seventy five bucks in winter, and one twenty five in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, but otherwise great”
Reviews.Author: Ambidextrous91
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 7 nights here with my fiancee and found this hotel added to our trip. The room we got was spacious and in fairly good condition if you accept the distrinctly dated decor. Hopefully they will start to do the rooms up soon. Other aspects of the hotel were excellent - service was always prompt, rooms were clean. Breakfast was a particular treat and is a real attraction of the hotel. The biggest let down was the pool, which is in the basement, and is really not at all special. The location is good for Stanley Park, however is a fair way from most businesses and shops. Overall though, a good base in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Staff gave excellent customer service, the Rooms and Hotel are old feeling”
Reviews.Author: Kootenaygirlz
Reviews.Content: We ended up transferring from the seedy Airport Coast hotel to the Coast Plaza. The customer service was out standing; in light of our encounter at the seedy Airport Coast they gave us a discounted rate and paid for the taxi transport. The room service was fast and courteous; our food was prompt, fresh and always hot! The hotel is very dated, as are the rooms. There may have been renovation, but you could tell the hotel was still old. We did hear the elevators running all night… we will choose another room location next time. This is not by any means a five star hotel. But the location is great; close to down town.

Reviews.Title: “Dated decor, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Maxing-n-Relaxing
Reviews.Content: The Coast Plaza was originally built in 1969 as an apartment block (I looked this up after sitting in the room trying to date the furnishings). It shows in the size of the rooms, which are quite large - mine had 3 closets and a kitchen with a fridge and microwave. The decor was very dated, although it was in surprisingly good condition for its apparent age. The bathroom had dated beige ceramics and a basket of small hotel size toiletries but also four jumbo size dispensers of the same liquids, which gave a somewhat downmarket impression. The hotel was deserted when I arrived yet the doorman stood idly by, watching me unload three bags from my car. However, the hotel let me check in early at midday (normal check in time is 3pm) which was useful. The hotel is in a quieter part of downtown, in a residential area above a fairly low end shopping mall. Location wise it is close to English Bay and Stanley Park but further from the main shopping area and entertainment district. If I had paid full rate I would have been disappointed, but for the rate I paid I was satisfied - but nevertheless pleased to move out to the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms could some updating, but great location”
Reviews.Author: TricotRo
Reviews.Content: Clean and very central if you want easy access to one of the best areas in downtown that combines restaurant variety, beach and park access. The decor needs an update, especially bathrooms but if they were updated the hotel would probably charge a lot more considering its location. It is great value for the money. Has a gym access agreement with neighbouring private gym, so effectively has one of the best equipped gyms ever seen by my uncle, who is a regular business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: UpthecreekEngland
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. It was perfect for our family wishing to sight see, go to the beach, shopping, cycling in Stanley Park, the harbour etc. Super staff especially at breakfast. Yes, the room was a little dated but very comfortable and excellent value. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay with Kids”
Reviews.Author: Macgirls
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. After reading other reviews had an idea of OK,a bit tired but in a good spot for Vancouver. This has not changed. Essentially it was comfortable, with large rooms. Its position is great for Stanley Park and downtown. We were able to hire bikes nearby and explore Vancouver under our own steam - this was great. We have 4 kids and it suited us especialy the swimming pool. As hotel pools go in inner cities this was a good one. My advice use it but be realistic about what you are going to get.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: jvptravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coast Plaza Hotel on our recent vacation to British Columbia. The first leg of our trip was in Victoria and we were pleasantly surprised with another Coast hotel that we stayed at. But the Coast Plaza Hotel in Vancouver was much more than a disappointment. The front desk staff was unfriendly and rude. The 1-bedroom suite that we were given had 2 double beds instead of the king bed that we specifically requested. The room was extremly outdated, with blue carpeting throughout, a tiny bathroom with zero space for even a shaving kit. The "full-sized" kitchen was also a let down. The large living room area had a corner dining area with a wooden table that was 4' x 4', and barely a step-up from a card table. The floor air conditioning did not work in either the living room or bedroom. In the living room, a portable air conditioning unit had been placed in a corner. The large unit was way too loud to run even on a warm day like the one we had there. And the bedroom had a small oscillating fan place on the dresser, with no other air conditioning. Worst of all, there were flies all over the room. The staff refused to move us to a king suite - without flies when I called and voiced my concern. When I went to the desk to complain to the manager, they finally agreed to move us. The new room had a king bed and no flies, but it smelled like raid, and the rest of the outdated and sub-par furnishings listed above were the same in the new room. This hotel sucked, and the staff was equivallent to the rest of the place. This was the first time on any trip that we made extra efforts to stay away from the hotel, except to sleep and shower. We tried (through our travel agency) to transfer to another hotel, but all of the hotels in the city were booked. We were stuck in this dump for two nights. When I asked about the hotel shuttle that was advertised, they said that advance reservations were required and that all 4 shuttle departures were booked. When I complained about the flies to one of the managers, he told me, "That's Vancouver. Flies are normal here." On the day of our check-out, we had six hours between our check-out time and the departure of our train to Seattle. I asked if we could have a 2pm or 3pm check-out and was told that the latest they could give me is 12:30 - a half hour past the posted check-out. So we ended up checking out of the dump at 8am and leaving our luggage with the concierge while we took a trolley tour of the town and saw the sights. I wouldn't recomment this miserable place for my worst enemy. If you are looking for a hotel in Vancouver, DO NOT consider the Coast Plaza Hotel and Suites, or you will be extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Looking a bit dated, variable staff, quite pricey”
Reviews.Author: Topoftheworldma
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a couple of times and always found it fine. The location is a bit quieter than the umpteen hotels on Robson and similar, as it's on the corner of a residential street. However, it's also above an underground (small) shopping mall with a food store, which can prove useful if like us you're traveling with a baby. Or there's a cinema next door, if you're not! The hotel's schtick seems to be that they have loads of grey squirrels (tree rats!) nearby, which are fed by the doorman and are actually quite cute. Last time I stayed it was twice in one 2 week trip, on the way out of and back into Vancouver. We got a lovely welcome back, the same 2 bed suite for the 3 of us, a plate of fruit and cookies - nice little touches. When we'd arrived on the outward journey the room wasn't ready so we were offered complimentary drinks while we waited in the bar or breakfast the following day (we took the breakfast, which was nice). The sports bar had great and cheap cocktails and we got absolutely ratted on our last night. All in all a very nice stay! This time was 6 years later, and the hotel is starting to show its age (as am I, I suspect, having acquired a husband and baby in the interim!). The rooms are a good size and the in-room amenities are fine, but nothing special. We had asked for a travel cot and were disappointed that they couldn't guarantee one - I actually found it quite stressful traveling for 20 hours not being sure there would be a cot for our 13 month-old baby at the end of the journey. And when we got there, the cot wasn't great - it was painted metal and looked like it wouldn't have been out of place in a Romanian mental health institution. Not terribly welcoming... The staff were variable - one (Canadian) concierge was fairly helpful, 1 very helpful, and the (English) doorman was a bit grumpy when we needed (politely asked-for) access to our car when a car-load of people were waiting to get into their limo. It's close to Stanley Park and therefore the ocean and the downtown pick-up places for Alamo and National car rentals (easy 15 min walk), which is also useful. The area feels quiet, laid-back and safe and there are various places to eat and drink within an easy 5 min walk. We had room service in the evening, which was actually pretty good and arrived quickly. Breakfast was fine, but not worth the high price - thank goodness we were still in UK price mode so weren't too fussed! We asked for a banana and a yoghurt for the baby, which ended up being more than 6 dollars - a bit steep. The waiter was nice, friendly and efficient and appropriately attentive to our needs. The hotel is OK, but needs updating, I suspect!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: scou
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a fantastic cruise to Alaska and finished off with 3 nights in this very friendly and well located hotel. Having arrived from our cruise ship at 8am we were very suprised to be given a room immediately by very attentive and courteous staff at reception. The view from our balcony overlooking Denman street was great from English beach to Grouse mountain.Definately recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wannabw0rldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Just got home this afternoon from a too short vacation in Vancouver. The first time we've been there and loved it! Coast Plaza was everything GOOD you'll read here. Staff friendly and helpful - we arrived at 10:30 am and were promptly checked in and upgraded to a suite even though we were only booked for a double room. Suite was large and clean - not fancy but very nice. Had a balcony and view of English Bay and Denman street. Housekeeping was prompt and thorough. Concierge helped us with several dinners and tours. Altogether a very pleasant hotel and wonderful location!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible view and location for a fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: cvillediner
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite for my family of five and found the rooms to be clean, spacious, tastefully decorated, and each with a balcony with a fabulous view. The price for a great suite on the 33rd floor was much less than I would pay for a crummy cramped room in NYC or Chicago. Every staff member was friendly and cheerful. The location was far better than I expected, just a block from numerous ethnic restaurants leading to the beautiful English bay beach, which was full of young couples, families, and senior citizens. The streets were clean and the cheerfulness of the people was contagious. Parking under the hotel was easy. Below the hotel was a mall with stores and a grocery. The only thing I found a little disappointing was that the indoor pool was devoid of sunlight and the whirlpool pretty lame. I left Vancouver wishing everyone in New York City, Chicago, and other large US cities could spend a week here and see what a really fine large city could be like. Friendly, clean, safe, beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JohannVienna
Reviews.Content: The Coast Plaza is very well situated, very close to English Bay Beaches and just a walk of 10 min away of fashionable Robson Street and Downtown Vancouver. And of cause, Stanley Park is just one block away. The Hotel itself is allright: Service is good, our room was very spacious but desperately needs a makeover, although it was clean. We had a very good price owing to the fact that we booked with hotwire.com. Taking this into consideration it was a very good value. If you don't have a view from your room go to the guest laundry in the 26th floor...the view is terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel because of Location and Convenience.”
Reviews.Author: HiHellowithKids
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family holiday in Vancouver with a 5 year old and twin babies. The major plus for this hotel is the location. There are no other hotels in this English Bay/Stanley park area that are in walking distance. There is the Sylvia, but we stayed there a few years ago, and the interior was brutal... The Coast is tidy, clean and albeit dated, it was a perfect base for our daily outings. At night, we were able to just go out with the babies in the stroller versus packing up the car and driving some where. This is the MAIN reason we selected this hotel. Having returned, we would book this hotel on our next stay because of it's inherent conveniences. Restaurants are everywhere on Denman street. The hotel elevator takes you directly to the mall level which has a Shoppers drug mart that opens 8am - 12pm, and a grocery store (Extra foods, like Loblaws, that opens 8am - 10pm). The rooms are reasonable large. We had a 1 bedroom premium room. There were some postings about the rooms having a musty odour, but no, there wasn't anything smelly. The reusable toiletries, are just in a pump and you can use them or use the single-use ones they have provided (probably because of the complaints). The kitchen is OK. Yes, the appliances are dated, vintage, 1980s or something, but we didn't really cook, just warmed things in the microwave and stored food/fruit in the fridge. The carpet was a bit dirty looking but OK again. The bathrooms were tidy, but dated. The linens were a beige colour and were clean but they were not the typical hotel crisp white. If you cannot handle a little dingy and maybe a little short-comings in the updated department, this hotel is not for you. If you want to have a hotel that is decent, tidy and a good location to actually do things in walking distance, then this is the hotel for you. I spent hours and hours researching hotels and really debated over the hotel, but fortunately for us, this hotel worked out. The other hotels I looked into would have been so inconvenient. In order for us to take our walks and strolls around town, we would have had to load the rental minivan up with everyone to do the same exact thing if we stayed at any of the other "supposedly" close hotels to this area. For babies in strollers - it was also nice to be able to go back to the hotel room if we forgot something. Hope that helps any families out there. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Vancouver & enjoyed my stay at Coast Plaza”
Reviews.Author: keithb789
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Coast Plaza, and would definitely stay there again. Yes, the hotel interior and rooms are a bit dated. And it wasn't "luxurious" by any means. The bed and linens were not of the highest quality. The shower worked well but the bathtub and tiles looked a little bit grimey. But I had a good time there. The good: - my room had a fridge, which was great for keeping beer/wine/snacks. - the view from my balcony on the 31st floor was awesome! A full panorama from English Bay to Coal Harbour, with the most excellent view of downtown. Only problem here was that there wasn't any furniture out there on the balcony, so I moved the desk chair out there! - I liked the bath and shower products. I forget what brand they were but the glycerin soap and regular soap were great. - I loved the location. Denman Street is nice with lots of eating options and shopping. Robson Street and Davie Street are a few blocks away, as are English Bay Beach and Stanley Park. - All the staff were friendly and helpful. - I liked having the Sav-On and Denman Wines downstairs in the mall off the lobby. - My room/floor was quiet, allowing for a good night's sleep. So all in all, the good outweighs the "bad". I had such a great time exploring Vancouver that I'll be back, and would consider staying at the Coast Plaza again, mostly because of the location and balcony view.

Reviews.Title: “OK, if the price is right.”
Reviews.Author: Nevileon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel courtesy of Hotwire at the discounted rate of $120 / night x 3 nights. Hotwire had rated this hotel at 3.5 stars. Upon check-in, we found the hotel to be quite busy. Apparently they get a large portion of their business from the nearby cruiselines. Check-in took approximately 10 minutes with a minimum of fuss. Parking is available at ~$18 / day. The hotel itself has a fairly decent lobby is situated just steps away from Robson Street (just a word of warning though - it's at the BOTTOM of the hill leading to most of Robson :P). The room we stayed in was on the 12th floor -- it had a decent view of the skyline and harbour. It also had a microwave, dishes, and a refridgerator. We found the decor and the linens to be quite dated and in need of replacement. We attempted to extend our stay to a fourth day, and were told fairly bluntly that the lowest rate possible at the hotel was $209 / night, almost double what we were paying. When we asked if we would have more luck on hotwire, we were told by the night manager that we probably wouldn't, since his hotel was very busy. That said, we tried anyway and rebooked on hotwire for $99 (actually LESS than what we paid originally). At times, we found the condition of the room to be somewhat unsettling. The maid had long black hair that we constantly found in the bathtub, on the bathroom floor and in the sink. That was exacerbated by the bathtub backing up during the first night of our stay. We should point out that this maintenance issue was dealt with promptly. We also found a used rag on our counter during the second night of our stay, and dirty pillow cases under the bed during the third night. Wireless internet is offered by the hotel, but is unfortunately unsecured (all one needs is a room number -- pick any number between 700 - 1900....). Because of that, the wireless network was congested and unusable. Luckily, the hotel does offer hardwired ethernet cables for use at no charge (but doesn't advertise that fact). In summary: If I were paying full price (200 / night) I would feel pretty choked. However, It has a great location (Stanley Park, Robson Street and city transit access). It certainly isn't the steal the $80 Hyatt was last winter =) but we felt that we got our money's worth (~130 - 150 / night including parking). Hope this helps somebody else make their Hotwire decision.

Reviews.Title: “We stay at the Coast Plaza in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: GHHUGH
Reviews.Content: We started vacationing in Canada in the 80's. Since that time we have gone to Canada at least once a year. In the beginning, we would stay a week at the Oak Bay Beach Hotel in Victoria and a week at the Westin Bayshore in Vancouver. In the early 90's we started looking around for an accommodation on the West Side of Vancouver that would offer a Suite with a full kitchen and a view of Stanley Park and English Bay. The Coast Plaza was our answer! We stay up as high as we can for a view of English Bay and Stanley Park. We love the idea that the Plaza has within it's complex a grocery store on the ground level which you can elevator down to without ever going through the Lobby and find those items that will keep you happy in your room with the view. There's Super Safeway a block over from Comox on Davies that has everything you would need for food needs. (Adjacent to Safeway is a Providence Liquor store.) The hotel can direct you to a Whole Grain Grocery store on Robson if your into more exotic fare. Our Suites have always had a super size King bed and television in the bedroom. A television, dining table and free computer hookup in the livingroom. The livingroom is large with a walk out balcony. Look on the Vancouver websites for dining and tours. But, please keep in mind that Vancouver is a very walkable city and public transportation is great. Tired of cooking don't want to eat out? Great room service menu. I've never seen on a room service menu Lamb Shank with all the trimmings for $19.00 and Bumble Berry pie Alamode. Wonderful! It's nice to be greeted by a hotel staff whom with with their smile and greeting say to you. "welcome home." I've only written one other review for a property and that is the Molesworth Suites in Dublin, Ireland. Again, location, location, location and friendly ,'we remember you staff.' Gary & Judy Holbrook

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, convenient to Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: oilerfan1980
Reviews.Content: This was an average hotel... nice, quiet location but would have preferred a bit more bustling atmosphere, this was my fault in selecting the location however. Very nice staff, they were always helpful. Outdated decor, but clean. I wasn't in Vancouver to fuss about purpley pink bathtubs, however if this is your purpose in visiting the Lower Mainland...choose another hotel. The most recent time I stayed in Vancouver, I found a hotel more to my liking in a different area...but for next to Stanley Park, this is pretty decent.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad - Best Location in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: gh5426
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Vancouver before, I was nervous going to this hotel because of some of the reviews I had seen on this web site. This hotel is in arguably the best location in Vancouver. It's basically right on the beach, is walking distance to Stanley Park and the Aquarium, and, my personal favorite, the ferry to get to Granville Island which is a short walk to Kitsilano. After touring other areas in Vancouver, it confirmed for me that this hotel was in a prime location. I can't say it enough. The location cannot be beat. As far as the accommodations themselves go, I can't complain. The front desk, doorman, and concierge were all knowledgeable, polite, and helpful. The room was okay. Not bad, but not excellent. There was no bathroom fan. Other than that, the suite was sufficient. We didn't spend too much time in our room, but it was nice to have the two rooms, and the kitchen was nice because we could go to the grocery store in the lower level of the building to buy breakfast items and water and things and keep them in the fridge. All in all, I couldn't be happier about our stay at the Coast Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't have been happier”
Reviews.Author: AddieSeattle
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Coast Plaza last weekend as a family reunion of sorts, celebrating birthdays, and other special occasions. There were 7 families represented. Everyone was pleased with their rooms, and the friendly, helpful service that we recieved during our stay. With that many people we had some special needs! Its an older place, but has been well taken care of, certainly clean enough for our picky group. The neighborhood is full of great eateries,and lots of fun to walk about. Stanley Park (the aquarium) is more than a few steps away...we drove, but access to our car in the basement parking garage was easy. I highly recomend the Coast Plaza Hotel, its a good value with a great view!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: TOgirl85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family in March '08. The location at Comox & Denman is hard to beat. It is walking distance to Stanley Park, and there are tons of cafes and restaurants along Denman. And it's right on top of a mall, which has a grocery store, so it's easy to pick up snacks & drinks or even food to cook if you're in a suite with a kitchen. The rooms are fairly spacious and comfortable. There is a great view (we were on the 25th floor). I think some of the reviews here are overly critical of the rooms. They are clean and didn't look that old to me. The bathroom tiling choice makes the ground *appear* a little dirty, but it's really not. The bath tubs are on the older side and should be replaced, but they're not gross. There is lots of parking available, and the hotel offers shuttles to certain tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: travelorOntario
Reviews.Content: My husband I and I stayed at this hotel last week. I travel a lot with work and I have never had such I terrible hotel. It was an apartment building built in the 70's and you can tell. I do not think that anything has been done to the building since then. I felt like my room was grama's apartment. The beds were gross. The decor was terrible. There was PURPLE tub and toilet! To make matters even worse there were bulk soap and shampoo dispensers that stay from guest to guest. It really did not seem very clean, nor appealing to me. There was also a very old, dirty fridge that ran very loudly. To sum up the room it was dark and depressing and did not feel clean at all! The hallway looks like something from a dorm room and the pool was in the basement and very creepy. We talked to the girl at the desk, and were told that it was an older hotel and they needed to do renovations. The view was nice, but what good is a nice view if the bed and bathroom gross you out?

Reviews.Title: “The best reason to stay here is a great view from the top floors”
Reviews.Author: PacificDelphinium
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend stay here when we booked on the spur of the moment in June 2007 for the jazz festival in Vancouver. The best part of the stay was the outstanding views from the room, which had a windy little balcony off the large sliding full length glass windows. I would definitely request a room high up, facing west. It was convenient to walking to Stanley Park, as well. I have attached photos to show that the view is, indeed, a highlight. Good for a couple; not so great for families with kids. On the downside, the hotel had a rather cold feel architecturally.. it just felt cavernous and designed to manage large numbers of people, rather than to provide a comfortable stay. The staff at the desk seemed extremely busy, but remained courteous. We did not try the hotel food. I probably would not stay there again, unless it was for another overnight in a similar room...quite expensive for the quality of hotel, I believe. One is essentially paying for location; and, hopefully, a view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times. The hotel is in a great location, very close to the beach and right on Denman Street with many dining and drink choices in the area. You can walk up the side street to view the West End neighborhood as well. The hotel rooms are average and somewhat in need of a re-decoration but they are large and most have spectacular views of the skyline and/or mountains. There is a full scale gym next door with a free pass included and a couple of restaruants on site. Definitely not a five star hotel but one I would highly recommend for the location and views.

Reviews.Title: “Not what was expected”
Reviews.Author: jamo007
Reviews.Content: The Coast Plaza Hotel is a good hotel for a short break in Vancouver, i would not reccomend to stay here for long periods of time.The exterior of the hotel looks a bit shabby but the hotel is at least making an effort in improving this.The hotel is located well in the downtown district. There are many small but pleasant resturants blending in with the cosmopoliton downtown area. Down the road close to Stanley Park, the harbour area is filled with expensive but quality resturants and some larger chain hotels. The hotel unfortuantly was not up to what i thought i had booked. The rooms were dated and i was on the 4th floor of the block. This ment i overlooked a poorly maintained roof which looked as if it had not been cleaned since the hotel was opened. Also the hotel did not have the room avalible which i had booked, so two uncomfortable 1930's hospital looking beds replaced what i had booked! The staff still seemed to manage a difficult situation well.The hotel resturant was clean and the food was nice. Unfortuantly i would not be returning to the Coast but this is only due to my dark and dingy 4th floor room. Im sure that on higher floors things may be different.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: carrotop
Reviews.Content: Nice surprise for a 3 1/2 * hotel booked through Hotwire for $74/night. Large room with queen bed and kitchen facilities with microwave and refrig. Excellent location near Stanley Park with indoor parking at the hotel for $17/night. The hotel looked modern, but could stand some minor updating. Long walk to the waterfront, we drove to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: chap0502
Reviews.Content: Arriving here on September 3rd for 6 nights with my wife to celebrate 35 years of marriage was a godsend after a horrific 3 nights in Kamloops. From the moment we pulled up in the hire car to transferring our luggage to our room the staff could not have been more helpful. ( nice of the front of house guy to advise that the valet parking would be $7.00 which we did not take up). This was new to us from the UK. I had booked a suite and both my wife and I were very impressed with the spacious suite on the 21st floor. What a view of English Bay and towards West and North Vancouver. What a city and what a hotel. The front desk and reception were fantastic with the only negative being a $17.00 parking charge per night. Glad to hand the car back after one night. All the staff were very knowledgable in relation to locations that we enquired after and even arranged for a couple of our trips. The complimentary breafast was more than adequate with excellent service considering the number of guests due to quick turn round guests going on cruises etc. We thought the location was fantastic being between Stanley Park and the Bay and the range of eateries on Denman Street was just amazing. Having scoured reviews of other hotels in the area and reading of clients seeing beggars in hallways etc in some establishments I was impressed with the security of the hotel. Unfortunately holidays come to an end and discussing transport to the airport a member of concierge advised to get a taxi rather than the airport bus. Well we were very surprised that the taxi fare was cheaper than the bus with a door to door service. Dave (58) and Sue ( a bit younger) Chapman Doncaster England

Reviews.Title: “A change of room led to a better stay”
Reviews.Author: sparkySussexEngland
Reviews.Content: We booked a five night summer package from the 4th - 9th August in a one bedroom suite. The summer package entitled us to free parking and $25 vouchers for each night of our stay toward food in the hotel. The lobby area was comfortable if not inspiring but check-in was quick and we soon had the keys to our room on the 22nd floor. We entered the room and were instantly disappointed. The furniture was very tired, the dining room table and chairs only had two chairs and we were a family of four, their was only enough cutlery for three people to eat at once. There were hangers in the wardrobes with cards on inviting you to use the robes, but the robes were missing, controller missing for one of the TVs etc.. We were paying $279 a night plus taxes and this room wasn't worth half that amount. So back down to reception to explain our concerns. We spoke to the front of house manager who was very understanding and arranged for us to be moved to another room. This couldn't happen until the following day due to a massive firwork festival in Vancouver and no available rooms. After a day out the following day we returned to the hotel to find we had been moved to the 32nd floor. Same style room however this one was much better. Furniture was of similar style but newer and overall the room had a better appeal, we still had to ask for an extra two chairs to enable us to seat four at the dining table. The location of the hotel is fabulous, Two minutes walk to English Bay or ten minutes in the opposite direction to Stanley Park. Plenty of places to eat offering massive variety. Make sure you visit the cup cake shop on the way to English Bay - Fabulous. We used the $25 vouchers for some evening meals and the service was excellent. The food was also of a very high standard, very well presented, hot and very enjoyable. The pool was fine for the children to play in however remember it is in the basement so lit by flourescent lighting, no natural light. Check out was very efficient and speedy. Overall I expected a better quality hotel for the money we were paying. The service we received was good but the hotel is in need of a major refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “good value in good location”
Reviews.Author: coldsprings1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights after getting a good rate on Priceline. We had a room on the 14th floor which had a great view, would have been better with a higher floor but was still good. Very quiet, large room with a small walk out balcony. It was very clean, as others have said the decor is tired. Didn't use the pool or restaurants as this hotel is located within walking distance of many small, non-chain restaurants. The extra parking fee was $20 and every time the valet has to bring your car, other than departure the fee is $8.00. The staff is helpful and the front desk changed $20 american into canadian for us and told us how to use the city bus. Would stay here again if we got the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Great location. Tired decor.”
Reviews.Author: napfan
Reviews.Content: West End location. Steps from English Bay. Sound enticing? It did to me until the minute I opened the door to my room. Personally, I loved the 80s, but even my parents have redecorated since then. Although the room was clean and spacious, it could've done with a total gutting. Dusty rose bathtub. Peeling wallpaper. Bulky, dinged-up desk. With that said, though, the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Always at the ready with directions and restaurant suggestions. Would I stay again? Probably not. Surroundings matter. Call me after the remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay property”
Reviews.Author: Lattenut
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel one night before our cruise. Room worked out okay, but was old and a bit ratty. Bathroom was tiny tiny tiny. Kitchen had a sink, small fridge and coffee maker. Reception was rude - told us we were 15 minutes early for check in - come back later. We went to lunch (the boathouse - great food!) and returned 1 1/2 later to a much nicer person. Can't say I'd recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: TXFamilyTX
Reviews.Content: This hotel has obviously not been updated in 30 years! The carpets were dirty and stained, the curtains were dirty, stained, and musty. The kitchen was old, old, old. The wallpaper was pealing off the walls. The bathtub had rust stains. The bathroom was tiny. My total bill came to $300CAD a night with parking and taxes! This was no luxury hotel and not worth $300!
