The suite was large but the bedroom smelled and the window didn't open enough to let in some fresh air (no a/c in the bedroom either!).

Reviews.Title: “here today, gone tomorrow (well....after 2010)”
Reviews.Author: grumpy-tourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in June as part of a large tour group. At the end of a busy Canadian tour we just wanted to chill and have a relaxing time in Vancouver. First impressions of the hotel were not good....yes, it's certainly looking a little tired. The rooms are a good size and comfortable, but have seen better days. This became more apparent as we were told that the hotel will be closing after the Winter Olympics in 2010 and may be converted in condo's. Now this is a shame, as it's certainly in a great location, a little out of town for some maybe, but Stanley Park and English Bay are just a short stroll away. Add the interesting locality of Denman and Davie streets and some colourful locals, and this is a great place to stay. We really enjoyed the hotel's Bar and Grill....very good food and top service with much lower prices than downtown. We did not try the breakfast as there are plenty of places in Denman St. Trolleybus 5 from Denman or 6 from Davie will take you into downtown (cheap and frequent) A pleasant walk round Beach Avenue will get you to the ferry for Granville Island....the markets there are excellent. Plus points; Location, Bar and service. Minus points; A bit tired, but it won't be around much longer!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at a comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: koko269
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Coast Plaza Hotel on July 3 and checked out today July 5. Check in was easy and so was checking out. Maybe because it wasn't on the weekend. It was an incrediably low key relaxing stay. The room isn't the most up to date with the furniture and fixtures, but that didn't bother me. My boyfriend and I decided to stay for 2 days just to relax and spend some time alone. My maid service was excellent and she even wiped under my makeup that I had put out on the bathroom counter. The best thing I have to say about the hotel is the location. It's literally a walk away from everything. English Bay, Stanley Park, shopping. If you are coming to Vancouver, I recommend this hotel for its pricing and location. Lots of restaurants to eat around here. I do have a favorite restaurant on Robson street. It's farther than a little walk. I'm fine with it because I love walking. It took about 10-15mins to get to "Guu." The best restaurant on Robson in my opinion. It's a place that serves cooked Japanese tapas. You have to get there early because there's always a line up.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malpal87
Reviews.Content: The Coast Plaza in Vancouver is located on the West Side of the city. The hotel is overlooking the English Bay. We booked through the internet, and they gave us a suite. Our room had a full kitchenette, a living room with a pull out couch, and a great view. The hotel is not quite in downtown, but it is about a 15-20 minute walk to all the great shops. Taking public transportation or a cab, it takes half the time. The food on Denman street where the hotel is at is amazing, all kinds of food for cheap. It was great, we ate mostly around the hotel the whole time because there were so many choices and the prices were incredible. The staff was really helpful throughout the entire trip, they always helped with taxies, gave us maps and told us exact directions and how to use the public transportation. The room was always clean when we returned for the day, and it is great for staying longer than 3 days because since there is a kitchen you can buy a few groceries to get through the trip. Great experience and would definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a great time”
Reviews.Author: nm838
Reviews.Content: This was the last stay on our trip, and what a great way to end it. There have been reviews about the 'tired' decor, but whilst there are older parts to the hotel, old light switches, old cupboards and decorating, this was a great hotel with a really comfortable feeling to it. The important areas, the reception, the staff, the incredibly comfortable beds, the incredble view of Stanley Park, the brand new kitchen in the suite, the level of cleanliness and the great location more than made up for some old fixtures. This hotel should not be dismissed because of some aged features. The mall with market under the hotel was fab, the location for Stanley Park (which is amazing) and of course the cupcake shop just round the corner ( which was worth every penny, try the carrot cake one!) made this a great stay. I would come back if I return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: jkaaz101406
Reviews.Content: My mother, brother and I were on a "budget" trip to Seattle and Vancouver, but since we saved so much on our hotel in Seattle, we decided to splurge a little and booked a superior suite for a little under $200 a night. We had two double beds in their own bedroom, a pull out couch, dining area, full kitchen, two TVs and a balcony with an amazing view of the mountains and English Bay. The hotel has an awesome location, where everything is within walking distance. The restaurants are amazing, have a variety of pricing, and are everywhere. The staff at the Coast Plaza was fast and friendly. The only drawback is parking costs about $20 a day (I'm still not used to this practice of charging for my car to spend the night too). Oh, and we were there during Gay Pride Weekend (end of July), which kind of freaked my brother out, but I didn't mind. So for those you who are, unfortunately, homophobic a bit, avoid this time of the year, as there is a Gay Pride Parade that marches directly in front of the hotel, there are gay weddings on the premises and all the bars close by fly rainbow flags. It was alot of fun, though being in an elevator with my mom and a pleather-clad dominatrix was quite a comical experience. If you can hang, just look at it as part of the local flair and go with it! I will definitely be back (August 2007, I think) and absolutely can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: BLynnS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night in 8/06. The reservation was made for my by West Coast Air because I had them package a deal that included a water plane flight (also recommended). For a "standard" hotel I thought it was a great deal. The room I got was large and comfortable with a great view of downtown. The front desk staff were very good and helpful. Even though they had a huge tours checking in and out, everything ran smoothly. I loved the location; it was easy to walk around the west end. Will definitely stay again my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Was very good”
Reviews.Author: joshbash
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal thru Priceline. I like the West End alo; easy walking to anywhere, good restaurants. We had a great view, were able to cook in the room... The bathroom was fine. The lobby facilities were somewhat limited, but couldn't beat it for about $65.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “SURPRISE SURPRISE!!! Yes I was surprised!”
Reviews.Author: kengaroo
Reviews.Content: I go to Vancouver quite a bit because it is close to me and I love the city. I booked the room through Hotwire for $68, but it was not the hotel I thought I was going to get. Yes I always spend at least 30 minutes trying to figure out which hotel it is going to be, is simply part of the fun for me with Hotwire. Was shocked and then concerned when it turned out to be the Coast Plaza I just booked. Reviews were not all that great for what I now know to be stupid reasonings...in my opinion. I had never been to this little spot in Vancouver before, and thus some concern about what I might have just done. My hopes were down. When we arrived, it didn't look all that impressive...kinda old. Once you step through the doors, it was a totally different feel. It was clean, bright, huge, and looked very classy. Outside yukky, inside awesome! You do have to pay to park, under their hotel, about $20 per day. The checkin was fast and easy, staff very nice and courteous. Lots of glass and marble, didn't look pink to me as others have whined about...and so what if it was pink?? Room was large and clean, with patio that had sliding doors open up to it. Our view was nothing special, but could tell if you had a higher floor, all views, whether it be the ocean or the city, would be spectacular. Ours was still very nice just on the 4th floor....believe it has 40 floors. Everything worked in the hotel...nothing to complain about. The pool is huge...and very WARM. Hot tub was hot enough, but it could have had a better jet system...big deal though! Both were inside so they are usuable all year. There is a mini mall on the lower level of the hotel...includes a store that has everything you could possibly need.....food of every kind included. Even had a movie theatre which was pretty cool I thought. The area around the hotel is what is best. Little shops and the coolest of cool places to eat. What made it so nice, was all these shops and eateries were not your typical places...they were unique and not your ordinary boring everyday places...they were very nice and different. Food could be had for a bargain in many places...and just about anything you could think of. It only runs about 5 blocks, but it is one of the most unique and affordable stretches in the city...I know think of it as my favorite little "unknown" section I have yet to experience. I give it it a 5 star rating here, because of it's uniqueness and how peaceful and quiet the area was....yet was only just blocks from Robson Street shopping and such. I didn't have a SINGLE bad experience during my stay there...well other than paying $11 for a movie in my room that was simply a really bad choice on my part...not the hotels. Anyone seen Jackass 2 yet??? For those that have, you know why it sucked to pay $11 to see it!! I loved this place, and will be back regardless of what I will have to pay next time. Not many places I am willing to say that about...so far only the Westin Bayshore and the Rosellen have that distinction in my opinion. I highly recommend giving this place a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Suite was renovated but still outdated”
Reviews.Author: Mary-Natalie
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and our 5 month old son for 1 night only (back in Nov. 06) and then switched to the Mariott Vancouver. The suite smelled like mould and the walls and carpet looked dirty. The crib provided was useless. Suite was renovated but still outdated. However, the suite was spacious and the view was nice. There was a full kitchen, large living room and bedroom. Hotel is a 2 min walk to English Bay and paths to Stanley Park. Good value if you're looking for space and need a full kitchen. Otherwise I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated 2 1/2-Star Max Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katskills
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire which categorized this hotel as a 4-star hotel. I have stayed in enough hotels to know this was by no means a 4-star hotel. At max, this is a 2 1/2 star hotel. The wait staff was average, but the room was horrendous! The bathtub was stained yellow and the hotel was outdated in every way imaginable. The decor is outfitted in furniture from what look liked the 70s; think wood formica doors, wood formica tables, white formica bathroom counters, fake crystal lamps. The room was dark, the lights didn't work in the kitchen and on one side of the bed. I paid $109 including tax which is certainly overpriced for a hotel of this caliber. I would not stay here again, nor would I recommend this place to anyone I know. Buyers beware!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Big room”
Reviews.Author: ManofSteel
Reviews.Content: My partner, 1yo son and I traveled to Vancouver via a week in Toronto. On arrival the hotel the Door man helped us with our bags from the airport bus. The desk staff were very friendly and efficient. The room was huge and very clean (if a little dated) nice well equipped kitchen and a fab view of Engilsh Bay. We had a complimentery breakfast vouchers courtesy of Thomas Cook Signiture wich was great as the resteraunt and staff were 2nd to none. I would highly recomend this hotel and the city of Vancouver. We will be returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities for families”
Reviews.Author: Debbie-Wales
Reviews.Content: The suites in this hotel are great value for a family holiday. A real luxury to have a separate kitchen, lounge and two TVs. The hotel is perfectly located with an easy walk to either Stanley Park or English Bay beach with a slightly longer walk to the "good" shops. Load of restarurants close by (useful as hotel meals, though good, were pricy for a family. If, like us, you don't want to carry your entire wardrobe, the laundry facilities are very useful. Only downside was that the views were iffy unless you were very lucky (or paid loads for your room).

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms but quite outdated”
Reviews.Author: Hardings
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property from Aug 2-4, 2006. It was wonderful to get a downtown hotel with a kitchen and a separate living room so the kids could sleep on the pull-out. This hotel is quite out-dated - no air-conditioning, older carpets, flooring, & doors, etc. And the kitchen had that musty hotel smell to it and was not outfitted well enough to cook in. We didn't end up using it, but it would have been difficult to considering there wasn't enough cookware, dishes, etc. Also, I must mention that breakfast in this hotel is completely outrageous price-wise. $3.75 for one cup of coffee - please. Maybe I'm out of touch with hotel restaurants, but all the prices seemed very expensive, and this is a 3-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay.... loved it even a little bit more!”
Reviews.Author: tribble300
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Vancouver in 9 months... I love the Coast. The room I was in faced English Bay. I had a great view. I think the room was recently renovated. I really had everything I needed there, including coffeepot. The front desk service was impeccable, The Bellmen were gracious and helpful. There is a large lobby downstairs, with comfy couches. The lobby is beautiful.... Recommendations: In my opinion, anything that you might want, or need during your stay is within walking distance. The Doorman has an incredible knowledge of the area, and will recommend places to eat, etc. There is a mini-mall attached to the hotel, that includes a grocery store.... and a coffee and sandwich store. Must stop at Cupcake. It is a few blocks from the coast. All they sell is cupcakes, but they are to die for. I tried their weekly special... which was strawberry kiwi with key lime icing... yum! Down Denman from there is Delaney's Coffee shop. Great coffee.... fun people watching... and great ambience. Down from there is Milestone. Chain restaurant, but I have had their chicken portabello... and it is worth it!!!! Also, at the hotel, watch out for Stanley. The bellmen feed the squirrels bags of hazelnuts every year. The squirrels... (all of them named Stanley, of course) come up and "squirrel away" their treasures... Stop groaning, you could see that one coming!!!! I spent a good half hour watching the squirrels! Very nice stay, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Scots_lass67
Reviews.Content: Loved it, not only the hotel but Vancouver itself. The location of the hotel was real handy for Stanley Park which is gorgeous and well worth several visits (we went 4 times during the week we were there) and also for alot of eating places and of course the shopping!!! If you are looking for somewhere to eat then I recommend Milestone's which is just around the corner from the hotel and the staff there are excellent. We only had breakfast in the hotel but it is served from 8am to 11am which allowed a morning swim and spa in the very quiet hotel pool. Breakfast really will last you until dinner, they don't believe in scrimping. Our room had a rear view and to be honest I didn't think of asking to be moved, and it allowed us to watch all the behind the scene activities that go on around the back streets of the city. I would love to go back, and if I do then I would definately be staying at the Coast Plaza again and a higher level would be requested on arrival. All I can say is GO!! experience it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Went out of their way to make our weekend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a terrible experience at the Century Plaza Hotel in Vancouver, we were set to cancel our romantic weekend and go back home. (If you are considering the Century Plaza, please read my review as it was by far the worse hotel experience I have ever had). A friend took me to the Coast, saying she had a good experience there in the past, and we went to the front counter. What a difference from the last hotel! The people at the desk were kind and friendly, and my friend explained to them what had happened to us and the service we had received. They were appalled, and went out of their way in every way to make us feel better. They booked us in for the two nights, and gave us a discount because I was so worried about money (having lost my other night's payment at the other hotel because they would not refund me) which I know they absolutely didn't have to do. The second night we were there, they booked us into a Jacuzzi suite, which was AMAZING! The gave us vouchers for a free breakfast, which was served to us in our rooms and was a real breakfast that was *delicious* and also some free drinks in their bar/restaurant. I cannot say enough for the desk staff, who made me feel so much better when I was near tears thinking that my anniversary weekend with my spouse had been ruined. She even gave me a little felt flower to "make me feel better". :-) The rooms were lovely. They were very clean, and the beds were so comfortable! Even the first night was so enjoyable! Between 6-9 they deliver free cookies and milk to your room, for the "comforts of home". The second night, in the Jacuzzi suite, WOW! Really, wow! The bed was huge, and extremely comfortable, the view over Vancouver city and the water was GORGEOUS and then there was the jacuzzi... Fit two people perfectly to sit and cuddle and watch the city at night time. It was so romantic and lovely, I wish I was still in there! We were also leaving the hotel on the day of the "Sun Run" in Vancouver, where several streets are closed due to the runners. The front desk staff was very helpful in giving us alternate routes to get home, and it ended up being a breeze! We were also impressed that they have dog friendly rooms, as we often travel with our dog and the hotel was still very quiet, and clean. I am so very glad that I was recommended the hotel, it made our weekend just perfect. All the bad feelings I had when I walked in quickly melted away because of the warm reception and lovely facilities. The location is very nice as well, we spent all day Saturday walking along Denman and Robson Street where you can find anything you want, really.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: amc48c
Reviews.Content: Normally travelling alone on business, in this instance, I travelled with my Wife and two children to Vancouver. This hotel was, overall, excellent in terms of staff service, room and location- equating overall with excellent value for money. First of all the service - our room was upgraded two levels on check-in when I asked for a rooom on a higher floor with a good view and wireless net access. So instead of a one bedroom suite, we were given a two bedroom corner suite with fabulous ocean and mountain views. Though the decor in the room is rather dated, it was huge (over 600 square feet) - and, with a family, space is better than a new desk in my view. There were many nice touches - staff remembered our children's names (Jenny in particular) and gave them toys on arrival. Nothing was too much trouble. Maids brought chocolates and water every evening - which was a nice touch. The location was good, close to a main shopping and restuarant distict. A grocery store in the mall below will cater for your everyday food needs. The kitchen in the rooms have the necessitites. And the price was very good - I paid around $C135 for our suite per night. Overall, the quality of the staff here was better than I have had in many more expensive and supposedly higher status hotels. The staff really are an asset to the company - and I am sure that with a family, you would be delighted with this great hotel. The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk from Stanley Park and about 15 minutes walk from Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Quite impressed with the place until”
Reviews.Author: maureenHartlepoolUk
Reviews.Content: On entering room was very impressed with the size and facilities- not sure about the summer months, as there was a free standing A/C unit. Rather dated , but clean. The lobby and seating areas seemed to have been refurbished recently- new looking carpets etc. Outside there were plenty of eating places and small cafes, from different cultures. All in all quite pleasant.A few down and outs, but that happens in all cities. The biggest shock came when we were in the long bar and grill having a drink, when a mouse ran across the floor. When asked by a waiter what all the fuss was about he replied "a mouse. we can't get rid of them" Needless to say the meal we had booked for New years Eve was cancelled and we went to the Boathouse.Whilst this did a very good steak, I cannot offer rave reviews about the cooking. A steak is a steak after all. Nice views over the harbour however.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Views”
Reviews.Author: Littleloobster
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of September. The receptionist was very friendly, unlike the three hotels we had previously visited on our travels through the US! Due to the original room we requested being unavailable, we were upgraded to an executive suite which was enormous. Admittedly the rooms are a little dated, but very clean. There were balconies from both the lounge area and the bedroom and the views were absolutely stunning. Due to this, we chose to eat in the room for a couple of nights and although the food wasn't fantastic, it was reasonably priced. I can't say the same about breakfast unfortunately. The concierge were also very friendly and helpful. I didn't find the area to be at all intimidating, quite the opposite. However, I think if we hadn't had the upgrade to the executive suite, it may not have been such a great stay.
